content:
Posted: May 21, 2015
												TL;DR:Had a bad first impression, while i looked up on the graphics. Then i saw it was on discount (2.34eur.) and decided to give it a try. I will never regret this. One of the best games i ever played. number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 27, 2015
												Ok, so this is going to be a verly decent length review of Risk of Rain, I have about 60 hours in it. and I have beat the game countless times. So, lets begin. As a I will be writing "RoR" as a  anagram for Risk of Rain.Risk of Rain is a sidescrolling 2-D platformer with co-op the sub genre of rogue likes, This means that every playthrough while can seem similer they will be 90% of the time different, also rogue likes are know for their brutal difficuitly RoR is no exeption to this rule though this game has a unquie mechanic there is a timer in the top  right coner as the timer goes up the game gets harder tougher enemies spawn this creates a great risk and reward feeling "Do I stay to get better items/level up or do I leave now with weaker enemies for the next level". With a amazing soundtrack that I can only describe as electronic orchestra and a 8-bit grapics style  that is pretty to look at. Like I said before the game by all means is a platformer though it as a emphasis on combat. The game has eleven playable characters most of which you unlock by a varity of ways, each character has a unique playstyle from the others.  as a example the acrid is a creature that uses acid to attack by either leaving it on the ground or shooting it at enemies  to do a damage over time effects.  Like mention before the game is quite hard on the default difficulty, while fighting your way on a  planet you crash landed on you find items and and dodging and kill the inhabitants of said planet. While you're in any said level you collect gold to buy items at shops that give you effects like for example, the Guardian's Heart it gives a shield that recharges after not taking damage over a period of time, the ukulele which gives a chance to do Area of effect electric damage on your hits. As you move along the 2d map either if its climbing upwards or to just going left to right you need to find the teleporter to move onto the next level, once the teleporter is activated a boss spawns with a timer, the timer counts down till you can teleport to the next level though you can only teleport once the boss is dead, once dead it drops a item, Once time timer hits zero and teleport but it also stops enemies from spawning on that level so you can quickly go buy something and head back if you choose no worrys about dying. The game has 6 levels of said 6 level  there are 11 map themes though the maps are partly randomly generated. Once you beat the fifth level you get a choose, go to the final level or go back to the starting level (though harder bosses and enemies spawn now to keep it intersting) and keep grinding items.  The game has amazing replayability with over 100 items! and being quite challenging this combinded with having co-op as a option in the game just results in a blast! Plus the game is quite cheap with it being eleven dollers flat. It also does a great job of saying "Game maker's engine can make good stuff as well guys!"I love this game, and enjoyed the time spent with it so much.  The game as amazing soundtrack solid gameplay that is satisflying/fun and a ton of replayabiltiy solo or multiplayer you're sure to have a blast. The game earns at least a 9/10.  (Would link steam page but we're here so...) To buy the sound track go here: https://chrischristodoulou.bandcamp.com/album/risk-of-rain (favorite track: Coalescence) Thanks for reading! Hope you could find it useful if you would like to send me any critism by all means post it on my steam profile/here thanks!  If you want to watch me play games I stream over at www.twitch.tv/mrfirestorm

												Risk of rain is a side-scrolling shooter with perma death and items you can buy from currency you gain from killing monsters. The longer you play the harder the game gets. It's simple, but rewarding. You start off with one character to choose from and start unlocking others with each having their own unique skills. As you play through the game you unlock new items.Risk of Rain is pure genuine fun without all the excess bloat that games seem to forget these days. Especially triple A games that seem to pad out too much story and excess content that drain the enjoyment that could be had. Risk of Rain is different and it emphasizes gameplay amongst all else. I can't recommend this game enough. It is an amazing roguelike-like and its one that i'll continually comeback to.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2014
												Risk of Rain doesn't go easy on new players, and its emphasis on luck-based variables brings up some minor problems. But for what it's worth, Risk of Rain is good fun and will satisfy most rogue-like/platformer fans looking for a challenge.Pros:* Risk of Rain, in spite of it flooding with RNG variables, is largely skill-based. It's up to the player to make proper use of his abilities, avoid damage, scavenge the map and make effective use of his time. While the player can collect many randomly generated items, some of whose effects also randomly proc, there's usually so much going on by the middle of the playthrough that it all averages out. There's a little luck involved in the harder difficulties, but in the end you can depend on yourself to overcome the odds.* Risk of Rain has ten classes, all with diverse abilities and playstyles. The huntress is a master of ranged harassment, while HAN-D is a health-regenerating tank that loves to be in the fray; many classes have ways of avoiding damage while some rely on brute force or territory dominance to survive. There are slight balance issues between different characters, but they're minor enough to not be a big issue, and the game is also balanced semi-regularly, helping to place weaker classes like the enforcer and sniper nearer to the top.* Game supports up to ten players, but is also plenty of fun in single player.* Gorgeous aesthetics and a solid soundtrack. The game explores its lore quite a bit through beast and item logs, although the vast majority of the playable characters unfortunately remain voiceless.Cons:* Some of the map generations aren't great. Item chests and obstacles are generally well-distributed, but the portal (your goal) and spawn point positions don't always favor you. One randomly occuring boss can give melee characters hell, while another for the same level is a joke for most characters.* You only get one character starting out, and pretty much all of the characters will require at least a few playthroughs for you to manage to unlock them. I would recommend starting the game on easy and looking at the Risk of Rain wiki so you have an easier time finding the characters you want.* Controller support is bare-bones. Doesn't completely support remapping, also doesn't work at all for some of the menus. Works fine in-game at least, I prefer them to keyboard controls.* Online support isn't great. Server setup is sometimes confusing, larger online games may suffer from quirky issues, some which unfortunately affect the playability of the game. Your mileage may vary.* Last level lags on some computers. Still playable.

												This is the best game ever! It's so satisfying to kill monsters as they continually increase in difficulty and the power-ups are so much fun to use. I can't wait to unlock new characters and play some more multiplayer because I honestly cannot wait to play some more Risk of Rain. Pros: - Amazing pixel art visuals- The soundtrack is both epic and retro- One of the main features is perma-death and difficulty, and it gets harder the longer you survive- Gamepad support right out of the box- Randomized environments and monster spawns make for a different experience every timeCons: - It's sometimes hard to see yourself in the middle of the action after stacking so many buffs on your character- There seems to be a bug where any Steam pop-up is increased in size ten fold when playing full-screen- It can be a little confusing to set-up a server for friends to play in, but local multiplayer is a breeze - Platforming can be a little wonky with a keyboard, though the controls themselves are very simple and easy to understand

												One of the single best purchases I made in 2013, Risk of Rain is atmospheric, difficult, but not unfair, and takes what I feel are the most fun elements of a roguelike (randomized item drops and permadeath) and combines it with a challenging platformer designed to get harder the longer you last. number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												This is by far one of my most favorite games of the year. It's like an old school shoot-em up, like Contra, pushed to 11. There are currently 10 classes in the game, each with a different skillset, so you should find one you are comfortable with. The classes range from a sniper who can one-shot bosses under the right circumstances, a riot officer who can plant his shield on the ground to absorb all damage from the front but renders him immobile and an engineer who can plant turrets and mines. You unlock each class by doing various objectives like beating the game or doing a mini event. Each class has four different abilities. You start out with the Commando who is very very good and is one of the best in my opinion (but I like the Huntress more). His primary damaging ability (spammable) is dual shot which fires two shots for damage,  a railgun like ability that fires a straight shot piercing all enemies, a dodge roll that gives you invulnerability frames, and an ability that can fire in both directions for quite a bit of damage. The overall combat in the game is very satisfying and if you die you know it was your fault and not the games. The game also has native 360 pad support, which is what I use to play, not so sure on the ds3 pad support though.There is a selection of active items you can pick up that can do some pretty cool things like summon some backup drones or summon a shadow clone to mimic your abilities. There are also many passive items you can get that give you various bonuses like enemies drop meat cubes on death that heal you when you pick them up, every 4th basic attack will pierce and summon bolts after you kill an enemy that will seek out others and damage them.The difficulty in the game can range from easy to holy♥♥♥♥♥♥this is the worst thing in the world, it really all depends on the items you get in the game. You can get some insane items on the first stage that can carry you through the rest of the game, like Infusion which grants maximum health on each kill or 56 Leaf Clover which makes farming much easier as it makes elite mobs, ones that have a white border around their health bar, have a chance to drop items. The level variety is really nice as they include a snowy levels, lava levels, underwater levels (no drowning involved!), and a space ship. There is also a hidden level in the game, can you find it without looking it up? The levels in the game are procedurally generated meaning that there will never be a chest inside a wall or the teleporter to exit each stage isn't inaccessible.The soundtrack in the game is just amazing, that's all I can say. Go listen to it for yourself! My favorite track is 


YouTube™ Video: Chris Christodoulou - Chanson d'Automne.. | Risk of Rain (2013) 

			Views: 210,942		

			Written and produced in 2013 by Chris Christodoulou Buy on Bandcamp: http://chrischristodoulou.bandcamp.com/album/risk-of-rain Buy on iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/album/risk-of-rain/id757699188...		

. If you want throw your money at Chris Christodoulou for this amazing soundtrack at http://chrischristodoulou.bandcamp.com/album/risk-of-rain.My closing words are BUY THIS GAME you will not be disappointed one bit.http://fc01.deviantart.net/fs70/f/2012/199/d/0/shut_up_and_take_my_money_by_lolikips-d34yx16.png

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 3, 2014
												A must have for anyone who is inclined to bro-op. The Good:The music is fantastic, each level has it's own and it fits wonderfully.Sound effects give you a feeling of immersion. Monsters make noise, your gun sounds badass, and the ding-dong-dong signifying things are about to get a lot harder is ominious as hell.The characters give anyone with any playstyle their chance to shine in a group.The item descriptions gave me a chucke the first time around, and even more so once I read about them in the item log.The Bad:Well, the "random levels" really gives you only a few variations of the same levels. The randomization is limited to where the items are, the teleporter is located, and whether or not certain artifacts are accessible.Multiplayer. IP connections? I'm disappointed, Chucklefish, but at the same time, i've come to expect difficult setup just to play a game that's basically designed for multiplayer. A browser wouldn't be -that- hard now, would it?Other Thoughts:I'm capable of powering through any game, and love the way you unlock characters by doing specific actions in-game. The ability to start out with a well-balanced character will definitely help newcomers become familiar with controls and gameplay.I lovingly bestow upon this title an 8/10. I highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys sheer ridiculous over-powered co-oping in late game.

content:

												No doubt - this is one of the BEST games ever made.Great rougelike survival experience combined with hardcore platformer mechanics. The replayability is insene. I literally spent HUNDREDS of hours playing that game, and don't be confused by steam's hours counter - I've been playing RoR since early pre-steam alpha, and from that point the game is only getting better.And the best part: the soundtrack. There are not many games that can make you prove You such an unique experience. Sometimes I can run the game just to listen some of my fav tracks. Never gets boring. Simply amazing.Gameplay is so entertaining that I constantly keep catching my self on ending "just a 15 minutes run" after 4 hours of playing... There are unique items to unlock, a whole bunch on characters with unique skillsets,  game tactics, character-related achievements, and over 50 different items that can stack endlessly...tl;dr version:If You never played that game, do it. You won't regret any second spend playing it...

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												This is an incredibly fun 2d roguelike. Like other roguelikes, it is possible to be killed throughout the game because of a simple slip up, and there is a reliance on getting the proper items in order to succeed in later levels. It's very possible to die on the first level simply because you don't find any useful items.The emphasis on "permanent death" for a character may be offputting to some, but beating the entire game takes about an hour, and dying is not a tremendous setback. The fun comes from the gameplay itself, not the progression to the end. The game is definitely worth $10 based on the singleplayer alone, and I've put many more hours into this game than games with a considerably larger price tag, but if that is not enough for you it has up to four player co-op. The multiplayer is fun but expect to die a lot more often. Money and experience is split between players which can make progress difficult, as items are not shared.This game is a great example of the roguelike genre, and great value for an individual or group of friends.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												If you're a fan of fast paced, action packed, RNG goodness then look no farther than Risk of Rain. This game will keep you (and up to 3 of your friends in local and online co-op) entertained for hours on end. The game contanis an interesting difficulty mechanic where as time increases so does the toughness. You are not alone though, you can defeat enemies and find other treasure to gain coinage which in turn will allow you to open locked chests as well as buy items from mini-stores. All of which, will help you in your adventure to beat the final boss. There are unlockable characters and items that you can obtain with each playthrough.So, if you are looking for a game and are unsure of what to get, don't hesitate on this one. Pray to RNGesus.

content:
Posted: May 12, 2014
												I haven't played many rogue-lites myself, but I really enjoy this game's approach and its well-defined classes. Each class (10 in total) has 4 unique skills, and they allow for some fairly creative gameplay. The first skill is either a basic ranged or melee attack, although, some classes have an extra snippet tagged on. The second and third skills vary but are usually some combination of attack, mobility, or utility. The forth skill is a class's most powerful and fanciful, with the Sniper and Engineer being the only exceptions.Similar to most rogue-lites, there is no shortage of difficulty or challenge, especially when you're 'doing it wrong'. Obtainment of items is essential, but with chests and icons (for item gambling) scattered randomly throughout maps, you must temper exploration and gold farming with efficiency, lest the game clock itself defeat you. You can also obtain hidden items called Artifacts, each possessing some sweeping gameplay change or addition when toggled. I personally won't play the game without the Glass Artifact because otherwise the items--rather than your personal ability--substantially dictate your performance.Co-op can be a double-edged sword if one of your partners is unfamiliar with the game. They may bring more firepower, but items and gold will have to be shared. Die too much, without optimal farm, and your partner will leave you behind for the rest of the game. This is kind of what I was talking about concerning itemization.

content:
Posted: June 7, 2014
												Risk of Rain. A game that prides itself on being insanely difficult. Right off the bat, a red flag. But! RoR is easy to pick up, with a small set of skills that must be executed flawlessly in order to beat the game (unless you are playing Huntress. Huntress OP).The game's selling points are perma-death (new term for "arcade") and its rougelike elements. Drops and enemies are randomized, while the ten possible maps are stitched together out of pre-determined chunks. It has a degree of arbitration while retaining familiarity to those who repeatedly play the game. A nice balance.The game is one of the best examples of modern pixel art that I can think of on the top of my head. It's really pretty. The movement is also very polished, with no little kinks as to how you are supposed to execute attacks--the ones you would find in games like CS:GO and Dark Souls.What's better yet is the game has multiplayer! PvE. But, this is where the shortcomings of the game begin. Multiple players are forced to fight over a fixed amount of item drops, which either requires a lot of teamwork, or having one person be the ♥♥♥♥♥ of the team who is insta-gibbed at the beginning of each stage because his teammates stole all the upgrades. While this allows for some strategy, a necessary part of good multiplayer, the scaling is just too unforgiving. Multiplayer makes the hardest difficulty look like child's play. The class balance is also a little wonky. Some classes are very easy to pick up (Huntress, Soldier, HAN-D), while others require ludicrous amounts of skill. Making some classes more difficult while others less so would make the game much better to play.Bottom line: If you are looking for an easy-to-play, hard-to-master game with decent multiplayer capability, get this game.8/10

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 27, 2014
												This game, made by Chucklefish Games (who, you should know, is actually making Starbound), is an addictive "Action-Platform"(however, little platforming involved) that involves collecting items, gaining levels, and clearing your way to the Teleporter to fight a tough boss.Pros:- Class diversity is pretty nice. At least 10 to play around with.- Game is rock-hard. This is actually good, considering it's actual difficulty. Not intentionally bad coding and programming (AKA: Dark Souls) to make it SEEM difficult. When you die, it's a mistake you've made (like jumping into a pit of mini-bosses or trying to run off a ledge on less than 75 health to your doom). It makes you say "OK, I messed up. Let's try again and see what I can do different to fix that."- Not a lot of platforming involved, but enough to give it a little Platformer feel, and that's not bad. It actually kinda helps the game, IMO.- Great item diversity. Lots to unlock, lots to test and play around with.- Cool art design. I just like how it looks. Could have been better, (look up TotalBiscuit WTF Is...Risk of Rain for his opinion on it. he's got more experience than I do) but it's actually kinda neat. I think the enemies just look REALLY nice.- Soundtrack is mind-blowing. All you need to hear is the music in the game. Just turn Sound FX to 0% and Music to 100% (or comfortable listening levels). It WILL make you love this game for one more reason.- Enemy diversity is not the strongest, but it's still pretty good.- The levels are randomly generated every time you play it. This enhances the difficulty, as well as it makes the game a semi-unique experience every playthrough.- This game supports Co-Op, both Local and Online. This is great for playing with friends, even if they aren't nearby. You may need them, because the difficulty while flying solo makes playing Co-Op feel like a cakewalk.Cons:- The game is rock-hard. I felt the need to add this to the Cons list as well, for the reason that it could very easily be a turn-away for some people. I don't blame them. I had the same eyebrow-raised kinda curiosity at it when I saw TotalBiscuit play it. I got it for Christmas, and it was probably one of the most enjoyable games I got.- The art design. It passes a kind of bare minimum. It's kinda nice, but had more potential. Disappointment to some.- The random generation. Some people like running the same course again with a different character to see how strong he is. I can't blame them. While I enjoy the random generation myself, some others will not care for it.- The visuals are taxing to some, even though the game's requirements are NOT high at all. Can't list this as a constant con, but it's definitely one that will affect someone with a poor computer. I run this game at 60 constant (mostly because I use Trillinear V-Sync to prevent screen tearing, a weird issue that follows me for no reason.) and have a decent computer.- The descriptions are not helpful sometimes. Like the Missile Launcher Mk. 1, for example. Description: Hooah. Does that tell you much? NO. This is a little thing that I could nit-pick on, but I won't.Overall, this game is worth your $10. If you're STILL unsure about it, just wait till it goes for at least 50% off. It's worth it. I will  probably make an addiction out of this game, just to listen to the soundtrack more. Just that good.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												This game is actually rather addicitve, it took me while to buy it, because my brother was REALLY trying to convince me to buy it, and when I watched gameplay, I couldn't see the appeal, but I eventually caved in and bought it in the end.And to my surprise I really enjoyed it.The simplicity of the way the game plays, and the simple pixel art works wonders for the game, and the music definitely completes the atmosphere.I do have a couple of things to say though.1: The music isn't 'AS' great as everyone seems to be making it out, yes, it's pretty good, but I have heard much better, it's definietly not soundtrack of the year, but you will enjoy it, I can promise you that.2: The game can start to slow down later on in the game, especially when you get to the last 2-3 difficulties and it decides to spawn about 100 enemies at once which it can't handle, especially considering by that point it's also trying to calculate the damage to all of them, and whether to make the 100 enemies explode, set on fire, give you health, bleed, poison, slow, and a few more things, this can slow the computer down if you don't have a fast enough computer to handle all of that.3: THE MULTIPLAYER SHOULD COME WITH A WARNING.  Basically, you have to either port-forward or use Hamachi, both of which are a real pain in the backside if you don't know what you're doing, luckily I have previous experience with Hamachi from Terraria's bad multiplayer.Let me point out though, that whilst the multiplayer is a real pain to get going, once you de eventually get it going, it's probably one of the best multiplayer experiences I've had in a while, and it's definitely worth iall the blood, sweat and tears it took to get it working.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
												Risk of Rain is the purest form of the roguelike basis: Every step you take, every second that passes is against you.Time is gold, and in this game, it means that your enemies will be stronger, faster and deadlier.Start with the simple, but flexible Commando, and mow your way through masses of increasing enemy forces, open chests with items that will give you handy skills, repair drones to help you against the onslaugh and reach the portal, to proceed to the next stage. Unlock new classes, new items, new encyclopedia entries and learn about the true meaning of your cargo, and your mission.In this game, everything is against you, but, you can turn the tides. Learn your class, use your skills to the fullest, and survive.It's kill or be killed. The difference here, is how you play.Survival of the strongest at it's finest.

content:
Posted: January 25, 2015
												No doubt - this is one of the BEST games ever made.Great rougelike survival experience combined with hardcore platformer mechanics. The replayability is insene. I literally spent HUNDREDS of hours playing that game, and don't be confused by steam's hours counter - I've been playing RoR since early pre-steam alpha, and from that point the game is only getting better.And the best part: the soundtrack. There are not many games that can make you prove You such an unique experience. Sometimes I can run the game just to listen some of my fav tracks. Never gets boring. Simply amazing.Gameplay is so entertaining that I constantly keep catching my self on ending "just a 15 minutes run" after 4 hours of playing... There are unique items to unlock, a whole bunch on characters with unique skillsets,  game tactics, character-related achievements, and over 50 different items that can stack endlessly...tl;dr version:If You never played that game, do it. You won't regret any second spend playing it...

												Great little game, fast, can be played in short sessions of no more than 1 hour, amazing replayability due to the random nature of items you get and very hard and rewarding experience, amazing soundtrack (can be seen and bought here: http://chrischristodoulou.bandcamp.com/album/risk-of-rain), the art style doesnt please me that much but its not bad, its competent, character model is a bit small and sometimes trhings can get very confusing when you have 300 monsters on the screen and youre shooting lasers everywhere, but still very funoverall great games for everyone that enjoys a good challenge, the platforming is a bit weak but the focus on combat is great, every class has a kit of 4 skills, a bit like dota champions that makes them pretty unique giving the game even more replayability, also very good coop, fun, but a bit messy, if the internet of the host is not good enough it can get very laggy, and if you dont know or cant open ports on your modem you might not be able to play at all unless you use hamachi or other programTl;Dr: great game, would rate it 8.5/10+great value+great gameplay+great soundtrack+lots of replayability+good selection of classes and items-issues connecting on multiplayer

content:
Posted: May 10, 2015
												MULTIPLAYER IS BRETTY DIFICULT TO ACTUALY PLAY DUE TO PORT-FORWARDING STUFF NOW STOP CRYING IN THE FORUMS JESUS. Best and easiest way to do it is to buy tons of cola and snacks and just have a good old fashioned LAN or 1-Screen round of fun.Crispy clean pixel graphics and fantastic music accompany this fun rogue-like platformer.You play as the worst space-postal-service-worker/space-truck-driver ever and lose your entire shipment of cool artifacts due to faulty bad guy teleporter shenanigans...or atleast thats how I understood the story. I like being the space-mailman.The game is pretty hard at first, but you will really notice that you are becoming more skilled after playing for some rounds. You will unlock cool new items to use in later games as well as neat and unique characters! The items you will find are, of course, all randomly generated. You will have to adapt your playstyle ever so slightly depending on what items you find. That being said, it is possible to play well even if you are not really happy with your item-combos. There is a bit of skill and know-how involved. Randomness and your own input and choices are well balanced.At the last level, you will have the option of traveling to the boss of the game or re-visit previous levels. If you re-visit old levels repeatedly...like...waaaay too much....may god have mercy on anything that stands in your way....

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												I very much recommend Risk of Rain.Simply put, there are no, truly new ideas here. Pixel art, an immersive soundtrack, roguelike elements, (such as randomized items enemies and locations) are all elements we have seen before.Risk of Rain ; however, managages to bring all this together in a fun way. The first few games you will get beaten very hard. Theres a lot of fun in refining and slowly improving your approach and strategy to what the game throws at you. I remember feeling the same way about games like The Binding of Issac. Improvement is through iteration, yet somehow it all still feels fresh and exciting. Once you think you've got it - a new character, weapon or item unlocks and give everythign a suddenly fresh new take.Perhaps one of my favorite things is the way items stack. Seeing the same item twice doesn't feel like you'v elost ground. Getting, say many missiles that increace the chance to fire a moarter blast can work toegher to turn your player into a mean machine, blasting rockets, bullets and mayhem everywhere. Theres is a great deal of satisfaction to unleashing a lot of carnage after an especially enemy filled screen or boss fight. The slow and incremental increase of difficulty over time, prevents meaningless grinding. You find the game is now a matter of maximizing upgrading, destruction and treasure hunting vs level progression. Its a good formula- and it scales effectively.I'm especially excited about the possibility of multiplayer, which I've yet to experience.The only downside, if there is one- is that the characters you can play, while interestingly differnt, are also radically unbalanced in effectiveness. Some characters, like the huntress really compliment the nature of fighting enemy swarms, and tower over the other characters in overall effectiveness. the sniper, by contrast, I can only see being used as a fully support character, and is simply too unuseable, and therfore not fun or exciting to play. I consider these criticisms minor. I'd be much more nonplussed by playing carbon-copy characters with different shirt colors. The great variety of playable characters only lends to the games strength.If you see this game on sale- just buy it. Its worth the money.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 18, 2014
												After a solid 30 hours of gameplay I have to say; I love this game. Risk of Rain is an interesting blend between platforming, action, roguelike and even some hints of (MO)BA. To avoid too much spoilers; it's a 2D game set in space, and you're a survivor trying to get off a planet. Ofcourse this planet can't be friendly, so there will be a large variety of monsters that you will have to kill to finally get off that planet. The planet and it's stages (remember; roguelike) are all randomly generated (and a joy to play!) Trust me; it won't be easy. Even on it's lowest difficulty Risk of Rain is a challenge as long as you play it alone or with someone equally inexperienced. But that's part of the fun. Risk of Rain will laugh at you, mock you (literally) and it will force you to think of a different plan every single playtrough. 30 hours and I completed this game 6 times on normal difficulty, just to give you an idea. Another part I love to address is the co-op element of this game. It's chaos, sometimes a little panick-y, but that doesn't make it any less enjoyable. The challenges accompanied by playing Risk of Rain make for enough of a challenge for even the most experienced players (up to 4), although divide and conquer seems to make it just a tad easier (just throw up the difficulty!). Lastly, the soundtrack. Risk of rain is an atmospheric game set in a 2D pixel art world, and it's the music that ties the game into an epic whole. If I wouldn't enjoy the gameplay I would still play Risk of Rain for the different soundtracks. They determine the mood of the game, and they do it with precision and style. Summary/TLDR; If you like roguelikes, platformers, chaos, pixel art or just great video game music, Risk of Rain is a must have.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 27, 2015
												This is one of the best games I've ever had the privilege to play. Sure, it can seem obtusely difficult at times, but when you mess up and die it's never the game's fault. You really feel like it's you that made the mistake. The exoctic alien planet you traverse throughout the game has been beautifully modeled with retro graphics, and the soundtrack is one that I would place very highly on a top 10. I would even go as far as to say It's even better than some other  popular roguelike platformers out there, such as Rogue Legacy and Spelunky. It could be that the gameplay is based more around combat, or that the difficulty increasing over time mechanic is unique to this game. You have to find a balance between slowing down to get money (or muney), tracking down items, and rushing to find the teleporter.  All of these make for an extremely polished and addictive experience, and the game doesn't take much processign power to deliver gameplay constantly at a silky-smooth 60 FPS. With several classes to unlock, artifacts to find, over 100 different items, and unlimited replayability due to random elements, this is probably the best 10 bucks you'll ever spend.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 5, 2014
												I give this an 8 out of 10. The gameplay is challenging, and it keeps you deciding whether or not to be rushing to the next level in hopes of beating it faster, or exploring for as many items as possible beforehand.The multiplayer can only be played with by friends who share their IP with you. This is one of the two flaws with the game that I have noticed. But other than that, what can go wrong with cooperative play while trying to survive together? Multiplayer takes teamwork. You cannot just hog all the items and expect your partner to survive.The other flaw is how things work with item unlocks. They force you to either get them by going into the game and actually only trying to get said acheivement, or you just play normally and barely get any of them. The less items you have unlocked, the less likely you are to succeed at this game, so start farming those achievements!A strong game overall with few flaws, would definitely reccommend this for anyone who likes a challenge, pick this up if you have the money. You will not regret it.

content:
Posted: January 14, 2014
												Risk of Rain is a slow boil that truly rewards the patient. Initially, playing the game can seem like an exercise in futility, as your character gets overwhelmed by massive odds. But slowly, as more and more items unlock and pile on, game play sessions tip the scales in the other direction, towards the absurd.Before you know it, you've got forty items, double, triple, and quad-stacked or more, and your damage dealt is measured not in tens but thousands. Lasers and missiles and explosions spew from your body with each attack, and enemies fall when they enter your immediate range. Suddenly, game play sessions that lasted 15 minutes seem paltry in comparison to your multi-hour runs, cycling through stages countless times as you run the hamster wheel of greed and mayhem.Again, Risk of Rain rewards the patient. Slog through your failures, and ultimately you'll come out the other side, 15 hours later, with the most fun platformer in a long time.

												+ Great core gameplay + Lots of items and characters + no two playthroughs will be exacly the same - lack of matchmaking - stupidly easy bosses Risk of Rain is a rouge like action "platformer" with heavy rpg elements, the game consists of chosing one of over 20 characters and building up a massive amount of items leading to incredibly satisfying gameplay just watching all of your item affects take place and complement your abilities, the game also has a lot to do, such as unlocking new characters, items and achievements. This keeps the game from getting boring. There are some bad things however, such as a lack of matchmaking for co-op and all characters not doing much damage with basic attacks and come bosses being stupidly easy but it won't stop me from reccomending this game

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2016
General Overview:As people continue to say and will always say after multiple hours of playing a game i must say this Review is overdue. Like damn this game is probably one of the best platformer, rogue-like games ive played in like an eternity sure i havent lived that long like come on thats a fair bit old id say, but this game is honestly amazing. It provides a perfected risk and reward system the reward loot and the possibility to leave the retched planet with your only your wit and assumed skills that you all propose you have to beat this game.Characters:Each character is unique, nad yes they all have different capabilities and weaknesses, have you ever wanted to butter up an enemy and give them a little heat them go for it. Want be the embodiment of a walking disease its all yours buddy because if you decide to get this game then you can do whatever you want in it, give a few enemies a slash, punch, bullet wound until eventual death, well each of these diverse and unique characters can fill your thirst for blood.Relics: These are special items found within in the game, they are of a higher and more mysterious background each one holding ancient power that you find in the world you have been stranded on. effectively they add game changing impacts i wont say anything to spoil i hate doing that but they make you play differently and make you approach the game in a new way with every different relic activated, its just beautiful.Unlocks, Achievements Etc:Everything you do in this game can unlock something say you kill an enemy, ho baby is that a monster log he just dropped yes it is indeed, these monster logs give you more information on the creatures you're fighting and added lore. Did you just manage to do a specific task with a character, well mate heres an unlocked item and a little more progress towards 100% completed game. There is multiple things you can unlock which is dictated by what you do in the game. So if you're a completion-ist then this game is for you.EnemiesI feel this game has a compelling amount of enemies that each do something differently with attacks movement and other minor details. Each enemy provides a different intake on killing and dodging. The enemies also later on during the game start to come in different variations that make them act differently and add an extra spice to them. Lets also talk about Bosses, these things are monsters they all are different and none feel the same as each other different looks and different intakes on battling also come in variations.Items:Items play a huge roll in this game, of course they do items = power, and what power the power to kill enemies easier and  with cool effects too. Each item adds to the player affecting the players visuals and general coolness. The items all have their own attributes that completely enhance one players abilities in the game. With these diverse and high quantity and quality of items you can become something godly, items can make synergies with one another you can make builds for your survivor anything to get you through the harsh worlds you have been escape podded too. cause come on who doesnt want to shoot homing rockets out their butt like they have some form of gastro affecting them.Difficulty:There are 3 different varying difficulties placed in this game and each provides their own purposes starting at the lovely Drizzle. are you a first timer then give this difficulty a try to get your ground even to test out some characters abilities you know a test run difficulty, next we have Rainstorm where i think most people do their starting game play you know this is where players can unlock new items and achievements for their characters whilst providing a moderate difficulty. Lastly of course we have Monsoon. This is where the magic happens mass enemy spawns, more elites more everything this is where the real challenge begins keeping you on your toes so that every move can decide your fate, just what you want on a friday night when ya get out of school and your like i want to play intensely weekend baby.Problecations... its a word:Now as much enthusiasm as i show for this game there is also problecations to the game and yes thats a word mate or gall please forgive me. There are a few bugs that exist in the game that probably will never get fixed but they are minor and completely unnoticeable, some items do feel completely useless which sucks to be honest but they quantity of items make up for it. Another problem is that the game feels somewhat abandoned by the developers i havent seen and update in many months and probably many more to come which affects the content which could be added. If not last its the multiplayer, if you havent port-forwarded your pc to make a custom ip and home port then this game cant really be played unless you're using hamachii or evolve which does it for you which can kinda suck.Final Thoughts:I honestly love this game and its defiantly a blast with friends without a doubt even without friends this game can take up most if not all of your spare time because each run you do in this game feels different, different things can happen in the game different items, bosses, characters, relics anything, theres an endless amount of possibilities that can happen in the game, each run is different and unique and thats why i play this game and love it more, this is why ill continue to play this game for as long as possible. At full price this game is completely worth the money its just so damn amazing, I highly recommend this game. Risk of Rain Review: 1005 Words

Posted: November 26, 2013
												Side-scrolling co-op action shooter with Roguelike elements (in the vein of Binding of Isaac). Fun for a singleplayer playthrough, great for repeated co-op playthroughs. The characters are well-designed and unique and you'll collect more loot than even Diablo would throw your way. Worth noting: There is no way to play with random internet strangers.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14, 2015
Genre: Hectic 2-D action platformer with roguelike RPG elementsGame Time: 4~10+ hours"The game is set in the distant future, where space transportation is common. Space trains carry passengers and goods all across space. A particular space train, however, had some very special cargo. Through a series of unfortunate events, this space train gets shot out of orbit and crash lands on a mysterious planet.. with one survivor." -From Risk of Rain WikiaAn Interesting NoteInitially the title "Risk of Rain" implies different origins. It could imply the pain from its roguelike elements or the loose plot where the cargo, which is potentially dangerous, falling onto the planet like meteor showers. However according to an e-mail response from the developers, "…it came around as an idiom of chance, because the game was very chance-based… It also coincides with the chests 'raining' from the sky, and our hometown Seattle."Initial impressionRoguelike games has never been my cup of tea when it comes to entertainment. Sure they're alot cheaper and are easier to purchase, but that's pretty much the only reason why I would risk spending even dollar on. Risk of Rain (as RoR) on the contrary made me thirst for more. I saw myself clicking the "play" button repeatedly and despite the length of the game, I had a great time shooting down critters and getting plummeted by Magma Worms."Visuals!"Assuming you have viewed the trailer, RoR is without doubt, pixel-based. This is the point where a surprising amount of customers have their opinion's divided. I personally agree with what Totalbiscuit said that there could have been more done with the visuals, but since the game can't get more visually neat than now, I see this as an reasonable compromise. We're talking about an Indie game here after all. In summary, the visuals are clean and are easily understandable. The colors don't feel dull especially when each one of the maps are distinct. The effects are flashy, and although you'll get to the point where everything goes fubar, the game is fair from what you expect. Oh, but them infinitely spawning Wandering Vagrants in the last level, they were a massive pain in the butt. Even if you're picky in-terms of graphics, getting frustrated and confused from how you died, or how you're being hurt will be the least of your concerns. Mechanics(Contents)Now in RoR you have plentiful numbers of passive items as well as interesting active items and drones you'll find throughout each randomized level. However what makes RoR so addictive aside from it's procedurally generated worlds, are its twelve characters that create a basis of your gameplay. You begin with the Commando, the standard shoot & dodge character, to the Acrid, a beast equipped with poison potentially lethal to even the hulking bosses of the game. Of course you will quickly create a preference on each character, but you'll be inclined to come back to for a refreshing gameplay, especially for Co-Op. The point that has to emphasized here is that to say the characters in this game define RoR, isn't even the slightest understatement. Experiment, and enjoy the variety. Most of all, have fun taking down hoards of those monsters. Before you get utterly destroyed, though.What the game offers Over a hundred items that are categorized with rarity, aside from a few, there are no two items that have the same effects. Interesting artifacts that mostly make the game hard, but more interesting. For example the Hive Cluster artifact makes the randomized loot, choosable. The Origin artifact on the otherhand, spawns Imps and a Imp boss every 10 minutes. Very limited, but unique maps that provide flavor and decreases boredem to the game.

												I rally wanted this game for a long time but i told myself 'i won't spend 10 bucks for pixel based game which was probably written  on the knee'...So yesterday i found it in library after friend gifted it to me. Despite platformer-like design and pixel graphics it turns out to be one of the greatest rogue-like games i've ever played ( at this moment deffinetly in top10 - somewhere after ADOM, DCSS, Ziggurat and Binding of Isaac and Dungeons of Dredmor) at least thats what can i say after barelly starting it . Im excited and lets hope its not only first impression :)

												Since Steam opened up Chinese region, a large number of Chinese players entered Steam. They no longer play pirated games, but pay for genuine games. Based on the huge population and excellent quality of the game, adding Chinese language support is clearly a win-win option, with a low cost in exchange for unparalleled reputation and substantial revenue, game makers really should consider it carefully. And as far as we know, compared to the quality of the game, the Chinese players prefer pay for the games which have Chinese language - even though it is not particularly good.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2014
												This game turned to be one of my favourite games for this part of my life. It's complex and simple at the same time. Select your hero (You have just one at the beginning, but you unlock more as you play) and release mayhem anywhere you go. The pickup system can look difficult on first sight, but later on you realize how it works and is terribly fun . The game gets harder as you play and the more you survive, the harder the enemies are. It can be really difficult to survive, but that's the objective. And once you kill the final boss, you feel incredibly well.On the counterpart, the frame rate is terrible in some situations that involve too many monsters. But even with that, I completely recommend it.

content:
Posted: January 12, 2014
												First i just wanna make clear, that this game has nothing to do with rain.This is, the best Rogue-like game I've ever played, the goal is to get items as fast as possible, hurry to the teleporter if you think you can beat the boss, you've got like 2.5-5 minutes if you dont want to get your♥♥♥♥♥owned in the next level, so you better hurry! It's basically the same in level 2, 3, and 4, but at the end of level 4, when you've beat the boss, it will ask if you want to start over with all your items, or continue to the final level. If you beat the final boss, you beat the game. It's MUCH harder than it sounds like, and Co-op is recommended for survival.Well I've beat the game, nothing to do here...  NO! This game has a great replayability, you can unlock new characters, items, achievements, beat highscores, and enjoy all the randomly chosen maps, each with unique background music. ALSO this game is made by CHUCKLEFISH, they make GREAT bagground music, and great games, AND THEY EVEN MADE STARBOUND! Worth 4 times the money if you ask me.

number of helpful: 12 of 22 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 25
												Activate the teleporter and hop in to proceed to the next level. A timer will be shown once you have activated it and need to survive spawning enemy waves for 90 seconds before the teleporter can be used. Defeat enemies, farm their gold and open chests with it for items. Items will give you perks. The problem I have with this game is the lack of balance. There a 2 scenarios possible. You are lucky and farm good items and become godlike or unlucky with item spawns in that you are unable to proceed further. When you have farmed good items and become godlike (there is no item cap) it involves zero skill and all you do is kiting and let perks do their job of killing mobs. The game throws so many enemies at you later on that it turns into a kite fest and most characters and their abilities become useless. There is no mechanism that prevents you from getting overpowered and still able to tackle enemy mobs without kiting. The game clearly lacks any balancing from mid to late game. You are also unable to play this with two controllers in local coop which doesn't make sense. Great concept and potential but ultimately falls short by design issues.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 1, 2013
												Risk of Rain pulls on the right strings for those who would love a fast-paced roguelike platformer.The things I love about this game are the procedural generation, the wide variety of items, the nostalgic yet fresh pixel art, an atmospheric soundtrack, and the 10 unique classes. All of that packaged together makes for some FUUUUN TIMES. Risk of Rain manages to feel new and exciting through multiple playthroughs and with each of those playthroughs being fairly short, it doesn't necessitate a person to dedicate a huge chunk of time finishing the game.There are things that warrant polish however. Some of the classes are much better than others, I think a few tweaks in the numbers department would balance the issue. The Multiplayer could use some additions, like being able to kick someone from your server, having a server save list, and being able to see a selected class's abilities during the selection screen are a few I can think of.Overall, Risk of Rain is a nostalgic, quick blast of fun well worth it when... Steam has it on sale. 7.5/10

number of helpful: 14 of 26 people (54%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 22, 2014
												The game has quite much potential, it's fun to play and its rogue-like elements work. Unfortunately it doesn't give very polished impression... some things in the game are carried out in ways that are sub-par. I initially tried playing the game on Arch Linux, but the x360 controller didn't work with the game (whereas it worked fine for example with Hammerwatch), so I changed to Windows. All games were played online.The biggest problem was that the Last boss teleporter crashed the game every time it was tried, which is game breaking. How can a game have so critical bug? In a roguelike it's utterly ridiculous that the game rewards the player always with error screen instead of last boss after 30 min of gameplay... no report option but just plaintext error. In a game where you start from the beginning after death, this is very frustrating.The game also had problems starting online coop which crashed the game twice. Before that the online game had some connection issues and the other player couldn't connect. Also, for some unexplainable reason, the enemies and other player started warping on one occasion. The ping is shown corner of the screen and it didn't really explain these warping issues. In this occasion the game played surprisingly well but things appeared somewhere where they shouldn't have.I'd really like to give this game a chance. Its gameplay is quite nice and fun but it appears to be broken. There may or may not be a fix for the gamebreaker, but it shouldn't be gamer's job to first keep googling for hours a solutions and after that keep playing half an hour just to see if the first one (or tenth one) solution had actually worked.EDIT: After ten more hours of gameplay and six more random crashes. The game keeps crashing quite often, about one time in a hour and a half. This means that every third run or so crashes. Besides that the coop has that last boss can't be fought because of that teleport bug.Also during these hours of gameplay the biggest problem of the game concept was revealed. The game has quite many items to unlock, but unlocking them doesn't really give awarding feeling. The biggest accomplishment of Binding of Isaac was that gamer experienced the unlockables awarding. In Isaac each unlockable gave a chance to get further in the game and completing the game gave new levels. In Risk of Rain the game can be completed with basic layout, so there isn't really need for cool new items. Also the waves that get more difficult as the time of a run proceeds don't differ from each other enough. I tought that after the waves "I see you" and "I'm coming for you" something unbeatable would have appeared. Instead just more enemies come and some low level boss enemies that can be easily farmed for powerups. The game doesn't award for speed in runs, instead it encourages the opposite, which really doesn't suit this game.

												   Possibly one of my most favorite games. Action packed never having a dull moment. While the game has recently ben given some bad credit due to bugs, I have experienced very little of this. Be warned though, those who purchase the game for multiplayer will require a third party software such as Logemein Hamachi(which personally does not bother me). A friend of mine told me of constant crashing and playthrough loss while in the middle of a match but I have never crashed yet. The Wikipedia page even gives out the source information so you can edit in any lost progress or just cheat for everything. Steam acheivements also seem to only work on Linux OS but cards are still available.10/10 Would framerate lag again.

content:
Posted: September 9, 2014
												Survival is the name of the game, and it will take a lot of skill, and lot of luck to win.The levels are random. The items are random. The enemies are (relatively) random. The only thing that doesn't change are the weapons you start with, and the music. At the start of every play, you will explore a unique maps to hunt for monsters and treasure, that will help you level up and become better equipped to fight the bigger and badder foes. But, as time progresses, the difficulty increase, so every second counts, and every decision, and every action dictates your chances for survival. If you think you've reached the end of the level, you better be prepared for the horde you must face in order to survive.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 2, 2014
												If you like rougelikes then you will like Risk of Rain. It has 10 classes to choose from each going for a completely different playing style. It works like this. You wake up from a crashed pod in either The dried lake or The Desolate Forest. You go around killing what spawns and the level is randomized, now sometimes the level looks almost completely the same as another time you played it HOWEVER it will NEVER have the same chests and definitly never have the same items because there are 100+ items. So you find the teleporter and For the next 90 seconds (or 120 on monsoon difficulty) enemys will spawn rapidly and at least 1 boss will spawn. at the end of the 90 seconds you kill everything left on the screen then you can go to the teleporter and you can teleport to the next level. But before we go there I need to tell you about the items and chests system. The items and chests system is easy, you get some money from killing any monster and you get some money if you open up these containers that are just sitting around. You spend money to open chests, for example on the 1st level you pay 25 for a small chest and 50 for a large chest. Im still not sure how it increases from there because on the 2nd level I will have small chests costing 78 one time and the next they cost 53. Every time you open a chest you get 1 random item from a pool of items im not sure how much you start with but when you complete achievements you can unlock more items to get. When you go to the 2nd level it can be either the Damp Caverns or the Sky meadow and you do prettymuch the same thing as the 1st level. find teleporter, survive for 90 seconds, kill all enemys, and go to next level. and level 3 is prettymuch the same and so is level 4 and 5 however the 6th... well ill just let you figure that out.As time goes on the difficulty gets harder at about 5 minutes the difficulty increases from very easy to easy then later to medium then to hard then to impossible then to some funny things ill let you figure out yourselfThe multiplayer works well so long as you know how to port forward if you don't know what that is then go look up "Risk of Rain how to set up a server" and you should find something to help you. Overall very good game 8/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7, 2014
												An addictive game of survival on a deadly world that actively seeks to kill you. The world will summon deadly monsters, but you can kill them to get money to unlock items that will help you survive. As time ticks on, the world will become deadlier, releasing elite enemies and boss monsters to send you to your death. The question becomes, will you spend more time in a stage to collect more items, or rush to the teleporter quickly before the diffuculty becomes too deadly? With 9 characters to unlock and over 100 different items to randomly find; this game promises numerous hours of gameplay.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2014
												Genre/game type - Sci-fi, 2D sidescrolling, action shooter, roguelikeI absolutely recommend this game, especially for the cheap price. Like most roguelikes, the essence of the fun is derived from each playthrough being a unique experience. While the levels are not actually randomized in the normal roguelike fashion, the collectible items are, so during each game you will find yourself sporting a unique arsenal of various weapons, gadgets, passive bonuses, etc.The real fun and the real challenge of this game are one in the same: being overwhelmed by strange alien monsters, and trying to shoot your way out. How well you succeed at this depends largely on what kind of items you were able to find while exploring (and collecting currency from slain enemies, to buy further upgrades). However, therein lies the rub: you want to explore, to gain more weaponry... but as the clock ticks, the difficulty rises, which causes more and more aliens to spawn.So do you explore more to find more life-saving items? Or do you rush to find the teleporter that will beam you to the next level (albeit ill-equipped to face that level, since you rushed to get there)? No matter what, the aliens are numerous, and unforgiving. This game is hard no matter how you choose to play it - but it's that special kind of hard that inspires a type of frustration unique to roguelikes - the kind that feels just as good as it does bad - the kind that makes you groan and scream upon each death, only to immediately restart for another chance at glory.My only qualms: the levels, like I already mentioned, could stand a little more variety/randomness. Also, while the overall pixel-art style of the game looks quite good, some of the items look a little clunky in appearance. Neither of these qualms are by any means a reason not to play the game - just possible suggestions for how to polish future iterations.One last thought: if you love sci-fi roguelikes, but were just too frustrated with FTL, this might be the perfect game for you. Different type of gameplay, but you're still fighting aliens in a space-like setting, and it's not nearly as frustrating as FTL could be.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												Risk of Rain is best described as a 2D action-roguelike-platformer. At it's core, players must proceed through random levels with different layouts in search of a teleporter. They must do this whilst fending off onslaughts of enemies, collecting items to live slightly longer and all with haste, as the difficulty amplifies depending on how long players have been, well, playing.Having crash-landed on an openly hostile alien planet, your job is to find your ship and get the hell off said planet. The local wildlife are highly unimpressed by your presence, and want to remove your face. And they will do so in droves.As players lurch deeper into the game, more items and characters will become available to them. For instance, take the Enforcer; a lumbering tank on legs carrying a shield and a shotgun. Yes, he's slow, but he certainly makes up for it with power.One of the more satisfying elements of this game is ironically when you meet your maker. Unlike most roguelike games, this game focuses on combat. This means that death is a matter of human error as opposed to shoddy game mechanics, luck and stats to determine a hit or miss. It feels rather satisfying, if you can overcome the game's steep learning curve.In short, Risk of Rain is an insanely difficult yet highly satisfying and overall fun game to play. The game also supports local and online co-op (which is rather rough but fun), so bring some friends along too if you want!

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												I think this game is a very good game for a lot of reasons. For one, it has a lot of replayibilty, all rouge-like games do. The maps are not "randomly generated" as much as other games, they all have static points but some of the map will change up on you. The loot locations will always be diffrent, and somtimes some areas will be open, or closed. There is a lot of unlockibles, and 10 diffrent maps you will see and enjoy. The enimes are pretty diverse, each with a little lore log. The bosses are similar to terraria type bosses, but they change up the game when they start spawning normaly. The whole game is set on a timer and the time you take fills up a difficulty metter. The "easy,medium, hard" mode you pick when starting just changes how fast this meter fills up. When the meter fills up, things dont nessicasrly just start doing more damamge making "artificial difficulty" but rather they start spawning more stronger enimiers, and more bosses. This game is very easy if you know how to dodge, and how to monover each of the enimies. Honestly, I love playing this game, and it is very addicting. The only part I can complain about is that it does get laggy near the end of the game.If you are on the fence about it, deffiently pick it up on a sale and try it out. I am sure you will enjoy it, and playing with friends jsut adds to the enjoyment.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 25, 2014
												If you ever want to relive the old NES days where game difficulty added to the fun this is the game to get.  Risk of Rain brings a refreshing and realistic difficulty factor.  The graphics on this game go to show, that not everything needs to be "pretty" to be considered a good game as gamers of the new generation would have you believe.  Risk of Rain provides you with multiple characters but only one starting character.  The game can be played single of coop with up to three other people which makes the game easier.  Risk of Rain was truly aimed at a single player experience but you won't last long if you don't have patience as the difficulty of the game increases the longer you play regardless of what initial difficulty you choose.  There are many lootable items that build your power, some may seem worthless while others more apparent in their use.  It is all about the drop and when it drops.  Choosing the wrong item when given a choice can make your life more miserable.  Bosses are challenging at first but become easier as you continue to play and learn the habits of the enemies and bosses.  Overall, this game has great replaybility and ten dollars is a fair price to pay for something that you don't see often anymore.... a well made game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 9, 2014
												Risk of Rain is a 2D platformer and shooter with roguelike elements, such as semi-random levels and perma-death.  You play as one of ten survivers who have crash landed on a hostile planet and must become stronger and collect the items necissary to survive long enough to hopefully leave the planet.This game was almost and instant favorite of mine given its high difficulty, even on the easiest difficulty, and unforgiving nature. The controls are simple: arrow keys move, space jumps, and ZXCV activate each of your four abilities.  The abilities are different for each survivor and along with different health, damage, and level multiplyers, makes each one have its own unique playstyle.  While killing enemies to level up is important, it is not nearly as important as finding and buying the appropriate items to aid you, as many of them can increase your damage, health, healing, or range, far more significantly than your level ever can.The music is well composed and enjoyable to listen to, which is saying something as I've heard every track hundreds of times now.  The artwork and style is all a nostalgiacly creative use of pixles, and the survivors and characters are all very creative and while some are reminecent of other games, they are still unique enough to easily differentiate this game's universe from any other.There is multiplayer co-op, but I have only tried it once.  Getting it connected can be a real pain, but it can make the game significantly easier.As of writing this the game still has some kinks.  It will not run on my computer unless it's through Steam and only if Steam is running as administrator.I recommend this game to anyone who likes a challenge as well as an old school experience.

content:
Posted: March 26, 2014
												9/10This is a very tough, very fun, rouge-like run and gun game. The permadeath element provides significant challenge and unlocking new characters is much more difficult than you would anticipate. The randomized level designs are great and provide a new experience with each play through. It took me about 7 hours to beat the final boss and another two before I completely lost interest. The game is worth the asking price but those prone to rage fits should definitely steer clear. The odds are very much stacked against you and death is all but a forgone conclusion for each play through. I would definitely recommend.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2014
												RoR is probably the most unforgiving action platformer I've ever played, and I love it. The game consists of you being stranded on different planets while plowing your way through hoardes of never ending aliens and monsters that would like nothing more than to tear you apart while you search for a teleporter to take you to the next level. You net EXP and 'muney' from each kill that you use to purchase items you'll find spawned randomly across the map, each one making you more and more powerful until your bottom screen is cluttered (in a "I am your dark messiah overlord you can never hope to kill me lul" kind of way) with them. Unlocking every character and weapon in the game is a hefty chore in itself and even though this game is great, I can't recommend buying it without a buddy system. The co-op is perfect with a friend to back you up, that will split item drops with you (pub games are known for free-for-all item hoarding which leaves everyone else screwed). So if you're into challenging, unforgiving, 'rougelike' killing action, give this a shot.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 5, 2014
												You climb from the wreckage of the crash and step foot on a new world. Stars glitter in an unnatural sky, and your boots sink into loamy soil that pulses and hums with strange energy. Beneath you, the planet stirs itself awake. Its defenders are ancient and alien and fierce, and you do not belong here.Move now, quickly and with purpose. This solitude is a momentary portrait, a gentle breeze before the first raindrops fall. With every ticking second, your enemy grows stronger and more numerous. Never stop moving. Time is entirely against you.Scavenge what you can and endure it. Weapons and supplies are scattered from the crash, and alien shrines might grant the planet's natural gifts to the clever or lucky.  Run until you can fight, and then fight until you can overcome.  Survival or death are your only options.The night is still beneath a lonely, indigo sky. A storm is coming. You can feel it in the air and taste it on your tongue like copper. You wonder – will it rain?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 10, 2013
												This game is truly a blast, with friends.I've had so much fun playing this game since I bought it but I don't really enjoy playing it much on my own but that's just me. If you're into Binding of Isaac or Rogue Legacy but want a bit more Sci-Fi in your suffering then you'll adore Risk of Rain.It's fast paced, it's well designed, it's beautiful and it's unforgiving. You have to work for your win and even when you get your win you might just be ♥♥♥♥♥ slapped back into the retro era for no reason other than the game felt like it.The longer you play the harder it gets, can you get more metal than that?The combat is fluid as it could be, the characters and abilities are varied and enjoyable. Each character brings something totally unique to the game. The only downside is how difficult it is to set up multiplayer which is where the game truly shines. In multi-player with everyone playing a different character this game is a cluster fun.If you can work past that one niggling issue then you've got yourself a seriously brilliant and well worth the price of admission video game.This is a very, very firm recommendation.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 28, 2016
												This game is amazing. The soundtrack by Chris Christodoulou is fantastic, one of the best soundtracks in an indie game, it's like a mix between rock and roll and the kind of music that pumps you up for teh adrenaline filled experience you have through the game. The rouge type elements keep you on edge, which is a good thing because you need to manage your time VERY WISELY, because every 5 minutes you spend in the game, the game gets increasingly difficult, so basically, if you aren't extremely skilled at the game, and you've spent 40 minutes in a round, you'll likely be killed in the next minute or so, unless of course you've already activated  the teleporter and defeated the enemies spwaned by it and are simply trying to get the achivement. The classes are also a fantastic aspect of the game, because they all have different styles of play and each class can appeal to a specific gaming style, for example, my favorite class is the Enforcer because he is the most realted to a Tank-type character in the game, but I know that the Sniper and Bandit are also very popular for being sort-of Ranger-type classes, which are usually the most popular in these kind of games because they can deal massive damage as well as being able to dodge attacks with relative ease. The story and collect-a-thon aspect are also very unique and rather fantastic because of the joy of getting/unloking new things as well as getting better at the game at the same time, and the story is simple and sweet, just like how these kinds of games should be, the only downside to having a simple story is not being able to talk about it without giving away spoilers. The non-spolier part of the story is in the intro of the game, you are a mercenary hired by a shipping company to guard the cargo of a shuttle; however, during the flight, a mysterious entity teleports onto the ship and blows a massive hole in the ship, destoying it. In the aftermath of the ship's destruction, you awaken in an escape pod, and have crash landed on a vicious planet where everything wants to kill you, but using your wit, skills, and whatever cargo you find throughout the world, you try to make it off the planet alive. I hope this review can convince anyone who reads it try out the game, take it from the 94% positive rating, this game is worth every last penny you spend on it.

												Don't let the initial difficulty turn you off. There's an excellent game to be had here.Much like Binding of Issac, the more you play, the more you unlock, the better items you're likely to get. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 13, 2016
												Risk of Rain is genuinely one of my favourite games on Steam. Through the suprising lack of rain there is an masterfully crafted rouge-like that doesn't shy away from mutilating your very soul on multiple occasions. It's frustrating as hell but in genius way, every death making you want to do it all again and prove the mocking death message wrong. There is no sort of proper story like some other rouge-likes, but it doesn't need one when you are gunning the heck down avian bird thingys with the much needed help of an electric ukelele - the story is that you're a rather small pixelated guy person, just go shoot some things without worrying about why you are doing it. As mentioned before this game is frustrating, which goes hand in hand with it's pretty steep learning curve, but every death along this curve seems constructive towards you as a player. Every time a robot guy smacks you in the face you still feel a peculiar sense of accomplishment, and every time you unlock a new character you may even find yourself shedding a tear  - which is something most games can't say they do. If you just want to play the video game equivalent of frolicking in a field then this game might not be for you, but if you are one of the two people in the world looking for a frustrating way to pass the time on a rainy day (hue hue) then maybe consider giving Risk of Rain a go. You never know, you might even enjoy yourself.
