content:
Posted: May 23, 2015
												Risk of Rain is an extremely tough (and fun mind you) platformer. You start the game with nothing, and by the end, you become a god. I bought this game a couple years ago, and not one day have I regretted it. At first, this game was difficult, but with practice, it becomes significantly easier. I'm not saying it become too easy, its still difficult on later stages. My brother and I used play this together every weekend (Before I showed him Warframe).Pros; Crush your enemies like the god you should be.Every game is differentInfinite hours of gameplayTonnes of unlockablesCharacter VarietyCons;Not updated frequently, it seems abandoned by the creator(s)Rage-inducingOne of the maps were broken. (After a certain point, you would fall through the floor and into the abyss) Even though I have played that exact map hundreds of times. (and I had good items too).This is one of my all-time favorite games. I am a little sad that there are little to no updates. But I still love it and would recommend it to anyone.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												This game is great. There's no other way to put it. Everything about this game has charm to it. The characters, the art, the music, and everything else. In fact, the art is quite possibly my favorite part. All of the pixel art is fantastic, and it all has a very distinctive style. Combine all of this great content with fluid and dynamic combat, new things to unlock, bosses to fight, characters and artifacts to find, achievments to obtain, locations to discover, and a sense that there's always something new around the corner, and you have one hell of an indie game. Now, as if ALL OF THAT wasn't enough to make you interested in purchasing this game, then here's a major point: This game has *FULL ONLINE PLAY*. You can play through this game as many times as you'd like with as many friends as you'd like. (I'm not entirely sure how many people can play at once, but I have seen groups of up to 7 people playing together at once. Beatiful chaos). If there's anything to compare this game to, it's Binding of Isaac. With all the items that you unlock through completing specific criteria, along with the rouge-like elements, it does remind me somewhat of Binding of Isaac. That may be another reason I love this game so much.The best way to explain this game in one long run on sentence would have to be...Binding of Isaac along with full online multiplayer, coupled with interesting combat, more characters, new items, lots of achievments, a ton of bosses to fight, artifacts which change gameplay drastically, fantastic music, and fantastic art.This game is a wicked ride, and I would HIGHLY recommend it to everyone! In fact, it's June 23rd right now, and this game is 50% off, selling at a dirt cheap $5 until the 30th! I'd pay $15 for this game if I had to, so $5 is practically stealing. If you've been debating whether or not to purchase Risk of Rain, STOP. The only reason I could think of to not purchase this game is the lack of money. I've enjoyed all the time I've put into it thus far, and I'm looking forward to the time I put into it in the future.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
												Risk of Rain is a shooter's paradise. Mow through tons of enemies, get crazy power-ups, and play as odd-ball characters. Its intense and enjoyable- more so if you have multiple people playing.The music deserves a special note as the progressive chip-tune sound track compliments the game perfectly.Another note is one of the artifacts, an option that impacts how the game is played, called Glass. Glass decreases your health to the point you'll die in one hit but you'll kill most standard mooks with a single shot. I feel like this is how the game should be played- brutal and evasive. It does make some item completely over powered, but if you play enough your character will eventually get that way.The game is short, sweet, and worth that 10 USD price tag.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												Risk of Rain is best described as a 2D action-roguelike-platformer. At it's core, players must proceed through random levels with different layouts in search of a teleporter. They must do this whilst fending off onslaughts of enemies, collecting items to live slightly longer and all with haste, as the difficulty amplifies depending on how long players have been, well, playing.Having crash-landed on an openly hostile alien planet, your job is to find your ship and get the hell off said planet. The local wildlife are highly unimpressed by your presence, and want to remove your face. And they will do so in droves.As players lurch deeper into the game, more items and characters will become available to them. For instance, take the Enforcer; a lumbering tank on legs carrying a shield and a shotgun. Yes, he's slow, but he certainly makes up for it with power.One of the more satisfying elements of this game is ironically when you meet your maker. Unlike most roguelike games, this game focuses on combat. This means that death is a matter of human error as opposed to shoddy game mechanics, luck and stats to determine a hit or miss. It feels rather satisfying, if you can overcome the game's steep learning curve.In short, Risk of Rain is an insanely difficult yet highly satisfying and overall fun game to play. The game also supports local and online co-op (which is rather rough but fun), so bring some friends along too if you want!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												The summer sale may have already destroyed my wallet, but it's the game I spent the least on that I've gotten the most enjoyment. The game is simply brilliant, from the addicting rogue like gameplay to the excellent electronic soundtrack. If you enjoy challenging gameblay, roguelike RPG's, or sidescrolling games this is simply a must bnuy, and I highly reccomend it to anybody else.Like any roguelike game this game does not hold back on the difficulty, but what's great about this one is that while the game is always challenging it has a perfect learning curve. You brobably wonn't make it 5 minutes your first playthrough, but each subbsequent playthrough you'll be able to see yourself getting better and better, you never feel like you're stuck at a certain point. This is a huge part of what makes the game so addicting, the ability to see yourself improve is satisfying beyond belief.The game becomes increasingly difficult as time goes on as well as advancing through stages, so the player must balance taking time to unlocking new items and rushing through the next level. There are a few options for which  version of a stage you will play, for example the first level may take place in a desert stage, a lake stage, and a few other options, and each time the stage will be slightly different than the last time it was played. This makes it possible for experienced players to become familiar with different stage without making the levels predictable or easy.The game boasts local and online multiplayer, and the co op play is a blast too. The fact that pleyers do not share items is a bit annoying, and since it is not possible to trade items it is hard to make sure your team mates are properly equipped. Also, online multiplayer is a bit unfinished so joining a game can be problematic, but the developers insist this is only a temporary issue and will be fixed, but is still worth mentioning (if this has been adressed at the time of reading, ignore this part).So far, my only other real complaint is the difficulty of unlocking new characters. In fact, that''s why I did not mention them earlier, I have only played with two so far. The challenges required to unlock characters are tedious and/or excessively difficult, to the point that the casual player may only unlock two or three ne characters, and only after a very long time playing.I highly reccomend anybody buy this game, and during a sale there is simply no reason to pick this one up

												The screen-shots and description really don't do this justice. Its a really really fun marriage of classic arcade style gameplay with modern complexity and depth. The difficulty is challenging in a way that feels incredibly fair and never frustrating, and the replay value is practically infinite. No 2 games will ever pan out exactly the same, even on levels you're revisiting or with a character you've already used. Speaking of characters, each one has a distinct and fun playstyle that really encourages you to try new tactics rather than good ol' run/gun. Achievements unlock characters and items too! This is just a really fun game.

												This game dumps you into a wasteland with nothing but the skin of your back. You will fight tooth and nail to cling dearly to the false concept you call life. You'll scrounge every last piece of gold, exp, and raw meat you can muster to keep going... just a little farther... maybe just enough to make it to that fabled teleporter. And then just as soon as victory is in your grasp, after overcoming all the seemingly impossible odds, the game will rip out your intestines and hang you with them like a noose. It will then insult you for your incompetence. All while you bang your head to a soundtrack fitting for your own merciless mutiliation.10/10 would die again.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 30, 2015
												One problem I've had with many roguelites would be the combat. Sometimes they didn't offer the weight and impact that make attacking and killing things feel good.Risk of Rain is one roguelite that gets that right. Attacks and explosions come with appropriate recoil and visceral feedback. The game gets this and many other things right.Each character has four abilities, giving unique flavor and utility to their gameplay. The character diversity gives great incentive for replayability since it'll be necessary to unlock everything. Furthermore, there are TONS of items that all bring creative, diverse effects to your attacks. Some items just buff your stats, but others have more interesting effects such as turning the enemies you kill into temporary ghost allies.The flow of the game works well, too. You need to kill enemies, get money, power up, and find the exit as soon as possible. The longer you take, the higher the difficulty goes. You'll die a lot, but it's part of the fun and you'll be eager to return.If there's one complaint I have with the game, it would be the ambiguity with some of the item descriptions. While you can view more detailed effects through the main menu, some of the flavor text can make understanding your items more difficult than it needs to be.Interesting items, beefy combat effects, and clear risk come together for a great experience. It's definitely one of the best roguelites around.

content:
Posted: April 5, 2015
												Definitely a tasty delicacy for any roguelike/openworld/randomly-generated lover fellow.I found many similarities to my favorite Binding of Isaac (and BOI: Rebirth too) but Risk of Rain provides the fun in a more aggressive way, more hardcore, if you say so. Two things I've been remembering all way through my humble time of playing (this will be fixed soon) are Terraria, from which Risk of Rain took some details and mechanics, and Rogue Legacy, which also has this extreme hardcore feeling, but lacks the flexibility.Guys did amazing job getting all the best together and Risk of Rain is a beautiful product, but pretty hardcore-ey - easy mode does not count any progress you made and is simply boring while normal mode goes way up so be prepared to have a tough start. Game is flexible and it requires you to be flexible as well. Do or die.8/10 will play moreBugs make some experience horrible.

												A really good coop roguelike. It has good depth to its mechanics. Using artifacts can really unbalance the game. Its most definitely worth the purchase for the price. Its one of the better roguelikes with a really cool end boss. The value of a roguelike goes with its replay value. While not as replayable as nuclear throne, you'll keep coming back until you see everything, and there is a lot to see.

												Probably the best Rogue-Like Permadeath game I have ever played. The game's simple visuals and gameplay are extremely appealing, and easy to get into. The class and item variety make the game have near endless replay value, as well as providing a new, different experience every time you play. With that being said, this game is not easy. You need to have an excessive amount of items to stand a chance, especially if you plan on beating the game. The last level becomes insane, and the last boss is a challenge in himself.10/10 A near flawless game that captivates time and time again.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2014
												Well, Risk of Rain is a game which I would highly recommend to gamers varying from casual to hardcore.It is a great game to play, either by your self or with friends, but personally I would say it is more fun with a group of friends!The gameplay is great, there is a variety of map layouts every time giving it a new challenge aspect each time; The replayability is great due to the different map layouts and the variety of characters to choose from.The art-style is simple, 2D and just plain awesome. To sum up this review:Pros:-Good replayability-Fun to play with friends-A good challenge, yet pleasing when you make it far-Wide range of Characters & In-Game items to unlockCons:-Co-Op can be buggy at times-Not everything is explained as clearly as it could be

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 29, 2015
												Risk of Rain is, I have to say, my favorite game of all time. There is so much to this game, because it is a very challenging game that takes time to get good at. It is very rewarding once you beat the game for your first time, but once you do, there is PLENTY more to do. Getting all the characters, getting all the artifacts, aheivments, and more and more. It is also very mysterious in a way that you don't really know how many people survived the crash, why the final boss did what he did, etc. It may seem like a simple game from the outside, but when you play more and more you can start to come up with theories about what happened in the story based on monster logs and the description of the items you unlock. It doesn't tell you of a story, nor is there even a story part of the game, but once you look at the whole picture of the game, there is, and that's what makes this cool. Not to mention the beautiful soundtrack, pixel graphics that make it perfect, and more. I would reccomend this game to anyone who likes rogue-like games. Risk of Rain is a very wonderful game, that I again have to say is my favorite game of all time.

content:
Posted: March 8, 2014
												A curiously addictive blend of platforming shooter with very high difficulty, 286-retro aesthetic, and some roguelike elements.  Risk of Rain is a little hard to get into at first, owing to the aforementioned high difficulty, but once you get used to the gameplay (and the fact that more often than not you're probably going to die horribly) the game gets really fun.  As you unlock more player classes and more items the enjoyment only goes up.One of my favorite aspects of Risk of Rain, and one thing which I think sets it apart from other roguelike-inspired games, is that there are NO bad items.  There are items which are better than others, as in any game, but nothing you pick up will hurt you ability to survive in any way.  It's only fair given how horribly outmatched you are by the game's enemies.  As the description of one enemy puts it, there is a dark humor in the absolute overkill you face.Though Risk of Rain is quite playable solo, it's even more enjoyable in a multiplayer environment.  The game's multiplayer system is admittedly a bit bare - you have to enter the IP address and port of the computer you want to connect to manually - but once connected it works well.  It's interesting to see how certain classes work together naturally, often in ways you might not expect.  Plus, your survival chances go up dramatically, which is a definite plus.Unfortunately, Risk of Rain is not without its issues.  Currently the game draws the Steam overlay twice, once scaled, once not, so if you run the game at anything but 640x480 you'll get a weird double image effect whenever you take a screenshot or get an in-game message.  Fortunately, the game runs just fine windowed with the overlay off.  Risk of Rain also has native support for most common game controllers, including Xbox 360 controllers, but the controller CANNOT be used to navigate certain menus, critically including the "select class" menu you get any time you start a new game.  Though it sounds minor, being forced to switch between mouse and controller rapidly becomes annoying over a long gaming session.Those issues aside, Risk of Rain is an amazing game that you can easily sink hours upon hours into.  Though you will die more often than not, the successful "overkill" playthroughs you manage will seem all the more sweeter for it.  If you have any love of platform shooters, you should pick this up.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2013
												First Impression: 9/10Imagine Rouge Legacy, smashed with megaman, a tiny bit of Binding if Isaac, and a smidgen of (very beautiful) pixel art and voila! You've got Risk of Rain.This game is simple in it's mechanics, and complex in it's growth. The power-ups make you feel a sense of progress but the bad guys don't ever let you take a back seat and enjoy an "easy ride". It is simultaneously enjoyable and frustrating, easy and difficult. This game will no doubt capture at least 50-100 hours of my time. And is easily worth the price tag.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2014
												I've never been this addicted to dying in such painfully stupid ways!Each playthrough is unique, depending on how quickly you can find the teleporter to the next level and which items you collect. The items really end up making the characters, along with how many drones you can find and handle along the way. At first I didn't think that the constant dying with nothing to show would keep me playing, but after finally beating the game (albeit on easy mode) after ~50 deaths, I can say that dying in a brutal, random and haphazard way (errant crab missile, ridiculous mob spawning all of a sudden, horde of teleporting imps...) actually makes me want to try again. Also, it never rains. Don't start planting your petunias on this planet.

												Risk of rain is a typical but not an easy pixelated rogue like, perfect for the classic roguelike lovers.The game offers a huge selection of items to upgrade your charcter(1 usable item + unlimited passive ability items), a large varity of enemies and bosses, plenty of achievements trough which you unlock either new classes or new items.Every class has its specific 4 skills each having its diffrent effect on an enemy/ies, making the gameplay and strategies very different with each class.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2014
Risk of Rain is an utterly infectious platformer game. Where it lacks in plot, it makes up for with crazy semi-randomized mechanics.You start out with four skills that slowly get augmented as you buy new items. Some will make your attacks faster or more powerful, some will grant new skills like the double jump, some will alter the game's aesthetic. All in all, the items (and tons of unlockables) keep the game fresh when first starting out.The game also boasts being one of the more challenging platformers. While your power level increases exponentially during your playthrough, the enemies become faster and stronger. There are no checkpoints, so if you die--you die permanently. With luck and a little bit of finesse, the game may be beaten, though.It takes a little time to get used to, but this game is really addictive to its core.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1, 2014
												Ninety seconds.... I was in ninety seconds before I met my first demise at the hands of seven-foot-tall lemur men in Risk of Rain. Now, one would anticipate that I would shelf this game and curse balefully in the corner of my room about this game's punishment.... But I proceeded to play three more times before killing my first boss and passing the first level, only to get curbstomped by the introduction of energy-giants in the second level, which took ten seconds......Risk of Rain is a roguelike that DOES NOT pull its punches and that's what makes it so wonderful. Character progession is based on gaining exp and item-finding in likeness of Binding of Isaac and the world adapts to your achievements. Over time, a clock counts the amount of time taken in a single run, and when it hits a specific marker, the difficulty amps up, and the fauna around you gets stronger and less tolerant of your existance on the planet. Rage will ensue. Good rage.

Posted: January 4, 2015
												Quite possibly the most interesting, intesnse side scroller I will ever play. You get to play and experince a small some of pixel-man become the mightiest force on screen as he becomes uber powerful and god like upon his oncoming, vicious foes. Really, most everything you come across is relentless if you don't act quick and try to keep up and stay ahead of your ever increasing difficulty meter, which is a concept I thoroughly enjoy. Depending on how quick you are, and how lucky you are with the world generation, you decide how difficult you make things for your self. The more people you have playing with you, the better as you and a friend combat the onslaught of pixel-nasties together and take on the mightiest one at the end, or atleast outlast him. Really its a game worth playing, and giving a shot. Several at that. because your promised to not last.

content:
Posted: January 3, 2014
												While the lack of cloud saving support (and the lack of a particularly user-friendly or reliable online play option) is disappointing [though this game is more designed towards single-player anyhow], this is actually a really fun game with a very rewarding and tight feel to every element of it, as well as a nice learning curve and plenty of unlockables and things to learn. Very much an action game, part side-scrolling shooter, part side-scrawling beat-em-up (with some classes), part roguelike, but incredibly satisfying and, well, fun. Which is odd to come from me, as more of a turn-based/strategy gamer.

Posted: January 4, 2014
												I'm going to go with a Giantbomb-style review and give this 2014's 2013 Game of the Year. There are multiple classes to unlock, many items to equip, intense action, and an increasinly punishing difficultly, but when the RNG rolls in your favor you will be Death personified in no time. When that happens Risk of Rain is sure to offer some of the best moments you can ever hope for from a game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
												A thousand times yes. You are a little pixel person who has to fight increasingly huge mobs as time goes on. You grab power-ups that stack, so after awhile you are emitting all sorts missiles, flames, mines, and health charges, dodging things left and right while enemies explode into showers of coins and experience baubles. The most interesting part is that each character plays very differently, which is then compounded by the items that come up in a given playthrough. What this amounts to is that each time you play, you find yourself adapting to a different and shifting tactical situation as you shoot a bunch of stuff and run around.Also the graphics are nice, the music is great, and the secrets and unlockables are fun. The netcode is pretty wonky, but they are working on it, and most of my currently 18 hours has been happily spent playing alone anyway.

												So your one of 10 special units that crash land on an increadibly hostile planet and all of your cargo has scattered everywhere! Doesn't seem too bad right? But what's this? The longer you stay there, the harder it gets? No worries. Your cargo filled with increadibly usefull items are all around you! .... That you have to buy out of the container, or kill the monster holding it... Not to mention, only the BIG monsters hold them... CHALLANGE ACCEPTED!!! Otherwise, great 2D platformer, LOTS of things to grab and power yourself up, and I see the game treating you in either two ways. It either decides to make you god for a day with luck of the good item drops, or virtualy slaps you, kicks you in the crotch and tells you to go outside. Over all, great game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 26, 2014
												9/10This is a very tough, very fun, rouge-like run and gun game. The permadeath element provides significant challenge and unlocking new characters is much more difficult than you would anticipate. The randomized level designs are great and provide a new experience with each play through. It took me about 7 hours to beat the final boss and another two before I completely lost interest. The game is worth the asking price but those prone to rage fits should definitely steer clear. The odds are very much stacked against you and death is all but a forgone conclusion for each play through. I would definitely recommend.

												Great visual and sound design make a great backdrop for this fast paced permadeath platformer.It'll constantly punish you, but you'll be relishing the experience rather than resenting it. Great drops that alter the play experience everytime have kept me coming back.You're restriced to one character at the beginning and his skill set is the most generic, but it doesn't take too long to unlock some more characters that add some needed variety.This is still in early access and it shows in some aspects, for examples, multiplayer support is quite poor currently. However it does support local co-op which is great if you've got a controller and someone to play it with. Hopefully this area will be improved upon in the future.Otherwise it's one of the best games I've played this year. Highly recommended.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 9, 2014
												Risk of Rain is a 2D platformer and shooter with roguelike elements, such as semi-random levels and perma-death.  You play as one of ten survivers who have crash landed on a hostile planet and must become stronger and collect the items necissary to survive long enough to hopefully leave the planet.This game was almost and instant favorite of mine given its high difficulty, even on the easiest difficulty, and unforgiving nature. The controls are simple: arrow keys move, space jumps, and ZXCV activate each of your four abilities.  The abilities are different for each survivor and along with different health, damage, and level multiplyers, makes each one have its own unique playstyle.  While killing enemies to level up is important, it is not nearly as important as finding and buying the appropriate items to aid you, as many of them can increase your damage, health, healing, or range, far more significantly than your level ever can.The music is well composed and enjoyable to listen to, which is saying something as I've heard every track hundreds of times now.  The artwork and style is all a nostalgiacly creative use of pixles, and the survivors and characters are all very creative and while some are reminecent of other games, they are still unique enough to easily differentiate this game's universe from any other.There is multiplayer co-op, but I have only tried it once.  Getting it connected can be a real pain, but it can make the game significantly easier.As of writing this the game still has some kinks.  It will not run on my computer unless it's through Steam and only if Steam is running as administrator.I recommend this game to anyone who likes a challenge as well as an old school experience.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												Risk of Rain is a pretty interesting little game, it has its bugs and issues here and there but let's be honest after the BF4 silencer, muting the whole server bug, what game doesn't these days. Let's talk about the issue at hand, Risk of Rain; there's a lot of different ways to tackle this monstrosity of a planet.The longer you take the harder the game gets and it takes this part very seriously, if you doddle or farm items for too long it can make things extremely difficult. Time equating to difficulty sure can make things interesting, as a farmer at heart it can sure make it hard to want to actually move on and continue through the stages but things can escalate extremely quickly. Items are similar to Binding of Isaac in how they unlock by completing certain feats/achievements. They also act similarly in function in that you can acquire one active use item and a number of(more than you can believe) passive stat and effect items.The game features several characters(10) to adventure through this wasteland with. You start with the commando which allows you to get quite a lot done for a base character almost to a point where sometimes I think it is better than a good few of the characters which is a bit of a con for me. The rest of the roster unlocks just like the items do, finding certain things in the world or unlocking specific achievements. The pool feels varied and interesting and if you enjoy the gameplay you will probably find yourself wanting to play the others through the game to unlock more items and any characters you need. The art style, music, and sound effects all feel very good to me but they fit my tastes and may not appeal as much to someone else. The game is primarily a singleplayer game but it also features up to 4 player local and online co-op which I have found to be a great time, the only real issue with the online is that you might have to do some network work to be able to host(open ports mainly, or turn off firewall). PROS: Flavour(art direction, music, sounds, etc.) is top notch in my opinion. Great replayability (At 20+ hours myself with about 64.5% game completion).Exciting number filled combat(Can turn off the numbers/combat text ingame if that isn't your thing).4 player co-op is great fun and classes function together in interesting ways.Has gamepad support.CONS:Port forwarding required to host.A tad buggy at times, weird issues and strict&limited graphic options.Can finish a playthrough in about 25 minutes on the easiest setting, if you don't count many many playthroughs to a game's total playtime, Risk of Rain is not for you.Some characters feel too weak or too strong.Keyboard controls can make it into Carpal Tunnel Simulator 2013 after too long of a sitting.All in all I would give Risk of Rain an 8.5/10, a quality game for $10, would like to see it get a few updates but I'm not positive on what the developer plans on doing at this point.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												Pixelated platforming monster-laden roguelike-like goodness.  The key defining features are:1. The pixel aesthetic; it's like Sword and Sworcery, only SMALLER.2. The excellent soundtrack, very much evocative of crash landing on an alien planet.3. The time-based difficulty.  Don't dawdle, or soon the enemies will be too strong for you to handle.4. The diverse classes, each of which specializes in a different playstyle.It's designed to be played again and again and again.  And you'll want to play it again and again, trying to get that one sweet run that gets you all the items you need until you reach that glorious state that the community dubbed "God Mode."  I've only gotten there once.  I hunger to get there again.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 21, 2013
												What is a strategy?By definition, a strategy is a plan of action or policy designed to achieve a major or overall aim. In this case, the overall aim is to get to the end of the game and beat the boss. Yet to have a plan, you need to know what you need to do. In the case of this game, the only things you know are the four skills that come with the character you pick. The game is a constant new experience every time you play it, no matter the difficulty. You could ace an excellent run, and die 12 minutes into your next run. This game focuses not on the story, and not on developing your character, but simply the experience. The item pool is huge- over a 100 items you could get that could come together and assist you in beating the game, or be completely useless. It all depends on your style of play. While the amount different levels you can get aren't too high, your starting location, item chests, shrines, and teleporters are all scattered about randomly each level to get a different experience despite it being a level that has been seen before.Another plus to the game is the multiplayer. It uses direct IP connection (like Terraria) so you can play with up to 10 friends or join a random group online. While a large amount of players can mean more firepower, monsters you fight become stronger and the overall amount of items you get doesn't change much- meaning to play as a team, you can't just pick up every item you get or keep every chest to yourself. You have to question yourself- "Am I able to play efficiently with the items I have currently?" "Does anybody else on the team need items?" "Do I really need this item?" Playing multiplayer focuses a major part on the teamwork aspect in the game.While there are upsides, there are downsides too. The biggest downside you will come to is the issue of lag. The game typically runs at 60 fps for everybody, and half that if you are recording. Once you get to high times and levels, the lag increases. The amount of monsters spawning at every second on and around your screen causes a lot of fps lag, and the graphics (while being pixelated) from attacks and item drops also boosts the lag you can get. In example, after 65 minutes of gameplay and 7 drones collectively firing at a large group of monsters, my game froze and crashed like the Titanic. I was upset because I just unlocked a new class and hadn't beaten the game as the class I was playing as. The lag is different for everybody though- it simply depends on how well your computer can handle it.All in all, I definitely recommend this game. It is well balanced and well thought out, and even finishes with a dramatic/feely quote that is different for each class you beat the game with. I applaud Chucklefish, the makers of this game.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2016
												Risk of Rain is a platformer alien shooter made by Hoopoo Games. The game isn't updated so often anymore, but it's still worth buying. It has fast paced shooting with a variety of characters, beatifully made pixel graphics and a lot of items. It has simplistic controls that change with every character, having strategy involved and smart thinking during fights.The game consists on a outsider crashing into a planet, where we must use teleporters to get to a new ship that Providence guards. So you must fight through levels, finding teleporters and fighting the boss that guards it. All characters have 4 attacks, having a regular attack with no cooldown, usually a more powerful AoE, a support attack and a powerful attack with a lot of cooldown.The graphics and music aren't the best, but combined they great an amazing atmosphere. Not much more can be said about this game, it's lots of fun and easy to start playing and get into, but require learning what every enemy does, learning all the advantages for each character and learning what each item does. Just all around great game, but with it's flaws, like the few bugfixes it gets.8.5/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 23, 2013
												I simply haven't been able to put this down since buying it. Solid platforming and charming retro-style graphics make a great presentation for this decidedly unforgigving rogue-like. The fully random level and item generation make for a challenging game that constantly forces you to adapt. Sometimes you find tons of good items and helpers, other times the levels are dry and force you to survive based on your raw combat alone. Unlockable characters keep the game fresh by forcing you to adapt to different playstyles, which simply adds a ton to the replayability when you also consider the three difficulty presets.Having the game increase in difficulty based on a timer makes for one of the most interesting challenge mechanics I've seen in awhile. You are forced to either farm every last item you can find to beef up against monstrously tough enemies, or rush for the teleports and have nothing but your own ability to see you through. Multiplayer adds a whole new layer of complexity and replayability, forcing teammates to best allocate resources.This is an absolute blast, you simply must buy this game.

content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
												Ok, I admit, I've been a wuss this entire time and played on easy (you can still unlock artifacts/classes, it just might not show until you restart the game), and I still find this game hard. Not that I care, I'm enjoying it too much.The controls are very simple. Arrow keys to move, Space to jump, and 4 abilities tied to Z, X, C, and V. Additionally, A/Q will interact with various objects, and G will use whatever held item you have equipped. This remains consistent no matter what class you play/items you use.The graphics are... admittedly mediocre, but they work well enough (and are impressive at times, especially near the end). The music is arguably the best part of the game; they fit the worlds well, they're varied enough to not get old, and the battle themes are suitably intense.This game does have balancing issues (notably Chef, Huntress, and arguably Acrid being considerably better, while Sniper lags behind in single player and Enforcer, HAN-D, and Bandito have problems no matter what), but each class (barring possibly HAN-D, as it's somewhat outclassed by Loader) still appeals for varying reasons- go with Engineer for turret/mine strategies and rocket spam, Mercenary for weak-but-fast hits and a pseudo Screw Attack with prior setup (see below), Acrid for poison spam, Huntress for shooting on the run (which is invaluable when you start getting faster enemies later on), Loader for grappling fists and the largest AoE in the game (place conduits diagonally to hit everything within a box), or Sniper for... sniping (and hitting multiple enemies in a line).Past that, there's the items. There are TONS of them, but they can be broken down into various categories (i.e. on-hit effects, on-kill effects, defence effects, out-of-combat effects, character effects, etc.). All of them can be useful at some point or another, but a few of them break the game when combined (i.e. enough Alien Heads and Rusty Jetpacks on Mercenary allows for infinite flight; Skeleton Key is really good early to midgame when you're wanting to save money for shrines and the like and excellent in the last level with all those chests near the end). In addition, there's Artifacts, which can be found in levels (some of them only appear on certain versions of stages) and will change certain aspects of the game when activated (Glass increases damage by x5 but cuts health to 10%, the utterly broken Command changes dropped items to chests that allow you to choose which item you want depending on rarity, and Distortion locks a random skill every so often, for a few examples).The biggest problem I have with this game is the different versions of worlds. Normally I like variety between games, but when I'm depending on getting a certain version of the world to get a specific unlockable, having to replay the game when you get the wrong world gets old fast (Magma Barracks being a major offender, having two variation-specific unlocks and requiring 20-30 minutes to get to).TL;DR couple of minor flaws, but a great game to waste time on and play with friends/alone.

content:
Posted: March 13, 2014
												Gameplay - 9/10Graphics - 10/10Music - 10/10Sounds - 9/10Options - 6/10Story - 3/10Starting with the lowest score, the story isn't really the point anyway.  But to be fair, it leaves much to be desired, even for a rouge-like game.  But how much story can you really expect from this genre?  I'm patiently waiting to be shown more.There are few games that have EVER been created that have intrigued me as much as this one has.  It has made me WANT to push further into it.  To actually work toward the achievements it has listed.  This alone is enough to put it near the top of my recommended list.It achieves that because it's incredibly fun to play.  Over and over again.  Losing actually feels like something that was by chance, not design.  And winning is so satisfying that it's something you'll want to tell your friends about.  It's that kind of achievement.The music alone is something I'd gladly purchase as DLC, it's that good (seriously, I'd buy this sound track even if it weren't part of a game I've played.)Overall - You should definately purchase this game.  You'll be extremely happy (if not surprised) by what it can offer.[Edit:  After owning the game for a few weeks, I've found a recurring issue with the sound failing on a regular basis.  This is very annoying as I find the game unplayable without it.  I hope this gets fixed soon, but keep that in mind if you're interested in this title.]

												After dumping a load of hours into this game, I can safely say that this is the best game I've ever played (and I've played some great ones!).What this game has: 1) Classes: You unlock different characters that play very differently from one another. Experiment and find your favourite play style!2) Loot: You unlock items to go into the game's randomizer, so gameplay gets more in depth as you go. Chance (risk!?) is involved, but skills are absolutely required!3) Atmosphere: Featuring some of the best music around, the soundtrack is to die for, rinse and repeat pl0x!4) Replayability: Wanna see how far you can go? The game is punishing, but it's not impossible to reach the 'end-game' where loot is abundant and effects slow down your pc so much that you wanna cry Q_Q10/10, easily ;)

												Procedurally generated side-scrolling action game with online and local multiplayer, Risk of Rain is one of those games that offers hours of replayability, due to the difficulty and many deaths you will experience as you learn the levels and enemies. Three different difficulty levels, many different unlockable characters, each with their own unique playstyle, as well as hundreds of items that will continually improve your character as you play, you can expect to come back to this game multiple times, even after you finally manage to beat it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 23, 2013
												I simply haven't been able to put this down since buying it. Solid platforming and charming retro-style graphics make a great presentation for this decidedly unforgigving rogue-like. The fully random level and item generation make for a challenging game that constantly forces you to adapt. Sometimes you find tons of good items and helpers, other times the levels are dry and force you to survive based on your raw combat alone. Unlockable characters keep the game fresh by forcing you to adapt to different playstyles, which simply adds a ton to the replayability when you also consider the three difficulty presets.Having the game increase in difficulty based on a timer makes for one of the most interesting challenge mechanics I've seen in awhile. You are forced to either farm every last item you can find to beef up against monstrously tough enemies, or rush for the teleports and have nothing but your own ability to see you through. Multiplayer adds a whole new layer of complexity and replayability, forcing teammates to best allocate resources.This is an absolute blast, you simply must buy this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2016
												Risk of Rain is a platformer alien shooter made by Hoopoo Games. The game isn't updated so often anymore, but it's still worth buying. It has fast paced shooting with a variety of characters, beatifully made pixel graphics and a lot of items. It has simplistic controls that change with every character, having strategy involved and smart thinking during fights.The game consists on a outsider crashing into a planet, where we must use teleporters to get to a new ship that Providence guards. So you must fight through levels, finding teleporters and fighting the boss that guards it. All characters have 4 attacks, having a regular attack with no cooldown, usually a more powerful AoE, a support attack and a powerful attack with a lot of cooldown.The graphics and music aren't the best, but combined they great an amazing atmosphere. Not much more can be said about this game, it's lots of fun and easy to start playing and get into, but require learning what every enemy does, learning all the advantages for each character and learning what each item does. Just all around great game, but with it's flaws, like the few bugfixes it gets.8.5/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												Aahh , Risk of Rain , where do i start ... First of all , this game may seem hard at first , but trust me , more and more you play , you will get the hang of it. This game is basically a run-and-gun with rogue-like elements. With 12 classes , each with 4 unique abilities , you wont get bord so fast. And dont forget the items , which are a lot too. The game may have some bugs , which is not nice , but you can get over them. And i almost forgot , everything is randomly generated , so no 2 runs would be the same.Now , regarding classes , my favorite part of the game. You start at first with only 1 basic class. Yep , only 1 class out of 12. You must do certain things to unlock classes , like killing bosses , reaching a certain level or in some cases even finding the other characters hidden in the game's levels. No 2 classes are the same , each one of them has an unique playstyle and set of abilities . For example , there is the sniper who excels at firing precise shots , being very good for dealing with bosses , but not so good for dealing with hordes of enemies. Or the enforcer , a tank who can stun enemies , or block all frontal damage with his shield.Now the items. Oh boy , there are lots of items . Some give you a shield , some make your attacks explode . There are activable items who can summon ghosts to fight for you , shoot a lot of missles and so on. The enemies in this game are well done , every stage bringing some new type of enemy . And also , you can buy drones to help you out in your journey . These drones fly near you and shoot the bad guys or heal you.And the soundtrack ? Pure genius.TL;DR Get this game if you like rogue like shooters with lots of classes and items , and most of all , good replay value.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2014
												Where to begin? This game is, frankly, a masterpiece in my eyes. There's a huge variety in items, enemies, and environments, the classes are unique and varied, and the soundtrack...god, the soundtrack is amazing. RoR also has an interesting mechanic wherein difficulty scales with time spent playing, going from "a couple weak enemies every so often" to "OH, DEAR GOD, THERE ARE SO MANY!" However, it's challenging without being unfair, there were never any points where the game just arbitrarily went "lol u r ded", it was always a case of "Hmm, maybe if I'd done _ differently..." In short, this game is fantastic for anyone who enjoys roguelike games and is looking for a "me and my friends versus the world" experience, and I can't recommend it enough.

content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
												Risk of Rain is a great game that seems deceivingly easy at first, but quickly becomes a challenge for most players. The combat feels different amongst each of the different playable characters, which is a good thing. There are unlockables and secrets galore (something that many games today are lacking, sadly), including characters, items, and "artifacts". Combining all of these elements makes for a game with hours upon hours of replayability.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2013
												Well...what can I say, man? Its a roguelike, and a damn fine one at that. The huge variety of items, situations, classes (That actually have a difficulty threshold to unlock, imagine that!), oh man, I could go on and on. Superbly difficult at its peak, coddlingly easy at its base. It expects you to grow as your session progresses, which is totally rad. Certain builds will always dominate certain classes, but thats the catch - In a game like this, you will almost never get the perfect build, and certainly never the same build twice.If you like roguelikes, you will love this.If you dont, you might still love it.Damn fine game.

content:
Posted: March 9, 2014
												Awesome graphics, awesome gameplay, awesome music. This game has everything you'd expect from a £7 pound game and much more.Each character drastically changes the way you play, if you try to play the sniper like you do the commando then its game over for you! This coupled with the partially randomly generated stages brings replayability I have never seen from any game before.Every single item is unique and well thought out (And at some points quite funny :D).The only downside I have found is the multiplayer, setting it up is a bit of a hassle unless you have access to you router AND you know how to portfoward with it. Your only other option is to use some VPN software like Hamachi which in mine and my friends' case seems to be incredibly slow.Overall Risk Of Rain is a brilliant game for those who have a low powered PC or those who love brilliant gameplay.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 22, 2014
												Risk of Rain is a very beautiful definition of a rogue-like game that is taken from a unique perspective. The difficulty scaling based on the amount of time put into your current game really encourages you to try to find the teleporter as fast as possible, while trying to gain levels and earn enough money to open chests, item pods, and buy drones to aid you through each level. Some skills with certain characters really complimented each others skills in general, and just their own skills themselves. The only thing I had a problem with myself is being able to obtain new characters. There really is no way of telling how to get the other characters in game (which don't get me wrong, surprises are nice, just a little help would seem to be nice) through the actual game, like others, you have to search online to understand. But overall, I would absolutely recommend this game.

												I really hated this game when I started playing it.  It was difficult, I didn't progress very far for at least the first 6-8 hours.  I even put it down for a month or so and didn't play it at all.  Then I unlocked the enforcer, then I unlocked a few items.  Then it progressed one level. Now I had to consider item loadouts and there is the really fun part of the game.  Once enough items were unlocked to make a difference in damage, health regen, survivability, the game became really fun,  I can't give it a 10 because I don't believe its perfect and thats mostly due to the beginning toughness.  Otherwise its fun if you stick it out.8/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												I possess a sordid love for this game. It is meticulous, harsh and a great bottle of fun for zero reason. The thrill of surviving as the difficulty scales up is enjoyable even as your screen becomes filled with more murderous beasties than is healthy to an atypical one-thing army. Each class drastically different, unlike a fellow game of the genre Binding of Isaac (where enough upgrades basically makes each character mechanically indifferent), and each has a kit focused for different tactics though pick-ups will carry the same bonuses or penalties. Learning how to use new characters in a way that suits you is another part of the fun of this game. I cannot comment on the multiplayer as I have not tested it myself. All in all, I think that it is a peculiar and fascinating game that requires equal parts luck and knowledge of the characters to grasp victory.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 18, 2014
												YESSSSS.A friend of mine gifted this to me on Steam. Thanks, Dayton Does! This game is freakin awesome. A side scrolling platform filled with monsters awaits you. Many classes to choose from, addicting enough to make you want them, and challenging enough to keep you fumbling around trying to get them. Plenty of powerups to keep it all novel. Go from a broke schmuck with a machine gun to an explosive harbinger of doom, shredding enemies with icicles, spewing missiles, and thqwibs. This game gets progressively harder the longer you play, and everything you can find along the way to help you, you better take. However, I do understand this game has its issues, too, which are worthy of mention. There are some issues with online play which definitely need to be fixed. There are multiple discussion threads about this in the forums at the moment, and I sincerely hope they manage to get it working properly for everyone, because this game doesn't deserve that bad rap. However, I'd like to say that local multiplayer works just fine, and is awesome. So, you know, if you neckbeards have real life friends, invite them over, and go on a grueling march through some interplanetary hell.Would I pay 10 bucks for this game, like they're asking?It's a little much for me. However, if I didn't have a copy and it and it went up on sale, knowing what I do about it, I would snap it up without a second thought at a -%50. As always, check Humble for this little gem.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												Risk of Rain is best described as a 2D action-roguelike-platformer. At it's core, players must proceed through random levels with different layouts in search of a teleporter. They must do this whilst fending off onslaughts of enemies, collecting items to live slightly longer and all with haste, as the difficulty amplifies depending on how long players have been, well, playing.Having crash-landed on an openly hostile alien planet, your job is to find your ship and get the hell off said planet. The local wildlife are highly unimpressed by your presence, and want to remove your face. And they will do so in droves.As players lurch deeper into the game, more items and characters will become available to them. For instance, take the Enforcer; a lumbering tank on legs carrying a shield and a shotgun. Yes, he's slow, but he certainly makes up for it with power.One of the more satisfying elements of this game is ironically when you meet your maker. Unlike most roguelike games, this game focuses on combat. This means that death is a matter of human error as opposed to shoddy game mechanics, luck and stats to determine a hit or miss. It feels rather satisfying, if you can overcome the game's steep learning curve.In short, Risk of Rain is an insanely difficult yet highly satisfying and overall fun game to play. The game also supports local and online co-op (which is rather rough but fun), so bring some friends along too if you want!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 2, 2014
												If you like rougelikes then you will like Risk of Rain. It has 10 classes to choose from each going for a completely different playing style. It works like this. You wake up from a crashed pod in either The dried lake or The Desolate Forest. You go around killing what spawns and the level is randomized, now sometimes the level looks almost completely the same as another time you played it HOWEVER it will NEVER have the same chests and definitly never have the same items because there are 100+ items. So you find the teleporter and For the next 90 seconds (or 120 on monsoon difficulty) enemys will spawn rapidly and at least 1 boss will spawn. at the end of the 90 seconds you kill everything left on the screen then you can go to the teleporter and you can teleport to the next level. But before we go there I need to tell you about the items and chests system. The items and chests system is easy, you get some money from killing any monster and you get some money if you open up these containers that are just sitting around. You spend money to open chests, for example on the 1st level you pay 25 for a small chest and 50 for a large chest. Im still not sure how it increases from there because on the 2nd level I will have small chests costing 78 one time and the next they cost 53. Every time you open a chest you get 1 random item from a pool of items im not sure how much you start with but when you complete achievements you can unlock more items to get. When you go to the 2nd level it can be either the Damp Caverns or the Sky meadow and you do prettymuch the same thing as the 1st level. find teleporter, survive for 90 seconds, kill all enemys, and go to next level. and level 3 is prettymuch the same and so is level 4 and 5 however the 6th... well ill just let you figure that out.As time goes on the difficulty gets harder at about 5 minutes the difficulty increases from very easy to easy then later to medium then to hard then to impossible then to some funny things ill let you figure out yourselfThe multiplayer works well so long as you know how to port forward if you don't know what that is then go look up "Risk of Rain how to set up a server" and you should find something to help you. Overall very good game 8/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2013
												Hands-down the worst part of this game is the fact that you start with only the Commando class unlocked, who is both boring and just generally bad compared to every other one I've tried. If you're lucky, you'll have a good co-player to help you through the game once, and then you can unlock some guys who don't suck and the game becomes quite a bit more fun. The game's definitely hard, but in general it's a lot of fun. You'll be blasting a hell of a lot of bad guys, and you'll get a wealth of fun item pickups and helper drones to do it with. As usual, I love the tiny pixelly graphics. I kept hearing this game has roguelike leanings, which I guess is true to a point, but if anything I feel like it could have used a little more roguelike influence. Mostly I mean that randomly generated maps would have been nice, instead of the same ones with the interactables moved around. True enough, the game will send you to any of a few different maps in varying order, and no two runs at the game will be the same, but it's still more of an arcade experience than a roguelike one.Uhhh well this 'review' has been a bit directionless, but the point is, there's a bit of an obstacle to engagement when you first start, but it's worth sticking with. Fun stuff.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2013
												The best game I have ever played, this game completed destroyed me at first, its difficulty was astounding, this may sound like a bad thing but it isn't. It provides a massive challenge that you feel compelled to beat, the soundtrack inspires that motivation and pushes you to see what the next stage is like. The timer creates a wonderful set of tactics not seen in many other games. You must beat the timer whilst also avoiding being underpowered for the boss and the next level's other enemies which for new players is near impossible. The game gives you the best feeling when you complete it, I raised my hands and cheered when I beat the final boss. This is a brilliant game and I absolutely recommend it to anyone, well worth the price.

												This game is absolutely fantasic.Made by Chucklefish, it bears slight resemblance to their more popular game, Starbound in look.That's where the similarities end.Like the description said, "Risk of Rain is an action platformer with roguelike elements", and those are very cleanly and elegantly expressed in the gamestyle.It's like Starbound on hardcore mode, with permanent deaths, that is, one death per randomly-generated world.Dodge terrible and evil monsters hungering after your flesh, wait for your special abilities to reload so that you can drive away the mob trying to kill you, dodge and weave around lumbering bosses with devastating powers, those are all the types of things you can do in the game.Also really nifty powerups. Those are cool.I give this game a 9/10Buy it.NOW.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												The summer sale may have already destroyed my wallet, but it's the game I spent the least on that I've gotten the most enjoyment. The game is simply brilliant, from the addicting rogue like gameplay to the excellent electronic soundtrack. If you enjoy challenging gameblay, roguelike RPG's, or sidescrolling games this is simply a must bnuy, and I highly reccomend it to anybody else.Like any roguelike game this game does not hold back on the difficulty, but what's great about this one is that while the game is always challenging it has a perfect learning curve. You brobably wonn't make it 5 minutes your first playthrough, but each subbsequent playthrough you'll be able to see yourself getting better and better, you never feel like you're stuck at a certain point. This is a huge part of what makes the game so addicting, the ability to see yourself improve is satisfying beyond belief.The game becomes increasingly difficult as time goes on as well as advancing through stages, so the player must balance taking time to unlocking new items and rushing through the next level. There are a few options for which  version of a stage you will play, for example the first level may take place in a desert stage, a lake stage, and a few other options, and each time the stage will be slightly different than the last time it was played. This makes it possible for experienced players to become familiar with different stage without making the levels predictable or easy.The game boasts local and online multiplayer, and the co op play is a blast too. The fact that pleyers do not share items is a bit annoying, and since it is not possible to trade items it is hard to make sure your team mates are properly equipped. Also, online multiplayer is a bit unfinished so joining a game can be problematic, but the developers insist this is only a temporary issue and will be fixed, but is still worth mentioning (if this has been adressed at the time of reading, ignore this part).So far, my only other real complaint is the difficulty of unlocking new characters. In fact, that''s why I did not mention them earlier, I have only played with two so far. The challenges required to unlock characters are tedious and/or excessively difficult, to the point that the casual player may only unlock two or three ne characters, and only after a very long time playing.I highly reccomend anybody buy this game, and during a sale there is simply no reason to pick this one up

content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												It's hard at first, but then when you get good... you get damn good and it feels good. If you are into skill based gameplay, and can handle the difficulty, you're going to have a good time. Run, jump, and 4 attacks.What, 10 characters to play as? Each with 4 unique abilities, having different roles and playstyles.My favorite playthrough thus far:The merc (unlocked by beating the game five times) is a full melee class. Difficult at first, leveling up gives more health and attack speed. Late game, he's got items for life leech, regen x 6, items to crit every attack while healing himself, increasing attack speed, exploding for spalsh damage, and eliminating cool downs. He attacked probably 3 times a second, and spamming his second ability, he attacked 6 times a second. He was a friggen blender by the end, out healing damage taken.Like this almost: 


my planet needs me 
Community Created Artwork for Risk of Rain
By: animatorZed

			Look at all those other chumps that think they need some fancy shmancy spaceship to get off this planet. I got myself a space jump and I'm just going to ride this here jellyfish to the stars.		


Killed a boss in 4 seconds, this was on Monsoon! (Hardest)This is one playthrough... Alone too, it's even better with others. I've had so many other awesome playthroughs with different characters. At least 3 more I can recall clearly. Do know, if you can't keep up the skill to survive, this game is unforgiving. You will die, many times. No respawns. You die, you start again with nothing.If you can kick♥♥♥♥♥unendingly, and take no ♥♥♥♥♥, only give; this game will kick♥♥♥♥♥ The music is good too. Worth the price, though I got it on sale. I then got multiple copies to gift to friends. I hear it's great with a controller, but I do just fine on keyboard.10/10, with great replay value.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
												Really beautifully pixeled game with creative monster design. I've only played this in multiplayer so far which in general works fine but has some "kinks". For example we need something like Hamachi to connect to each other, it's not working with the steam overlay friends invite, sadly. Also, if you die you can only wait while your friend(s) keeps playing the level, you will only be alive again when the next level starts. And then you will be at a disadvantage because while being dead you did not pick up any new items that would make you strong enough for the next level. Also, sometimes there are so many monsters piling up that you can hardly see your character anymore.The game, even on easy mode, seems really hard at first, but the longer you play the easier it gets. This, I think, is in part because you unlock more and more helpful items that you can get. It is different on every playthrough and I prefer to play it with a controller instead of the keyboard.

content:
Posted: March 10, 2014
												This game's greatness is masked behind its graphics. They're dated and don't do much for anyone who isn't into the super retro style. This is the only complaint I have about this game. Its multiple character system, combined with the hundred or so items and online multiplayer can mix up the gameplay every playthrough. The best part is that none of the characters feel like carbon copies of each other. Gameplay gets absolutely mental very quick, with a time based difficulty system. As more time passes, the more numerous and powerful the enemies become, eventually leading to bosses spawning on a regular basis. There will be plenty of deaths, and sometimes you'll get a game over just because of a bad line up of item drops and enemy spawns. Not for impatient or easily frustrated people.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 1, 2013
												Risk of Rain is an awesome buy. I didn't know what to expect of it when I first saw it in Steam's Greenlight program, but the more I watched videos of its gameplay, the more I beecame enticed to discover this little gem's secrets. The game never starts out too slow, keeping you constantly on your toes as enemy difficulty scales to being just short of impossible every time you level up. However, don't lag behind in your search for the teleporter each level, because the longer you dilly dally, the greater the risk of maybe not surviving this trip. With absolutely insanely inspired bosses popping up like those mushrooms in your yard, a rediculous amount of passive abilities to aid you in your quest, and some pretty awesome characters to play as, this game is nothing short of unique. However, take caution if you want to get this game so you can your friends can play together online. RoR requires you to have an 'open port', which may come as an easier feat for those computer savvy than those who aren't. Local gaming requires you to have both a keyboard (duh) and a gamepad.  I have yet to open my port for online play,  but that hasn't dissuaded me from playing this game way too much. Buy it.Now.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												I think this game is a very good game for a lot of reasons. For one, it has a lot of replayibilty, all rouge-like games do. The maps are not "randomly generated" as much as other games, they all have static points but some of the map will change up on you. The loot locations will always be diffrent, and somtimes some areas will be open, or closed. There is a lot of unlockibles, and 10 diffrent maps you will see and enjoy. The enimes are pretty diverse, each with a little lore log. The bosses are similar to terraria type bosses, but they change up the game when they start spawning normaly. The whole game is set on a timer and the time you take fills up a difficulty metter. The "easy,medium, hard" mode you pick when starting just changes how fast this meter fills up. When the meter fills up, things dont nessicasrly just start doing more damamge making "artificial difficulty" but rather they start spawning more stronger enimiers, and more bosses. This game is very easy if you know how to dodge, and how to monover each of the enimies. Honestly, I love playing this game, and it is very addicting. The only part I can complain about is that it does get laggy near the end of the game.If you are on the fence about it, deffiently pick it up on a sale and try it out. I am sure you will enjoy it, and playing with friends jsut adds to the enjoyment.

content:
Posted: September 15, 2014
												I've really enjoyed this game, while the content can be a little repetitive the large variety of classes makes replay a really fun experience. My one big gripe however is sadly Risk of Rain is missing the steam cloud save feature. It was really disappointing to reinstall my system and find that all my time invested was for naught. At this point I've lost my interest as unlocking content a second time is not all that appealing. All in all however Risk of Rain is easily worth the money and is sure to kill more than a few hours of your time. Just be sure to backup your data if you chose to reinstall or the like.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 25, 2013
												Risk of Rain is a great platforming action game with roguelike elements.Every game starts with a clock adding up the time spent playing and every minute gets harder and harder.You start off with one selectable character, unlocking more as you progress and preform challenges such as beating the first level under 5 minutes.The game really gets intense once you get a handle on the character you'll be playing as, my favorite being the huntress, and the amount of action going on at once is almost staggering. The game has plenty to offer for those who just need a few minutes to play a game, as the longest I've survived is about 70 minutes. Once you die, it starts all over but theres collectables and info to amass. I especailly liked the stats page which tells you how far you are from 100% as well as little tidbits of info such as favorite weapon and time played.Overall, worth the price.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2013
												This is a good casual game but also a great cult classic and is definitely worth purchasing.  I grabbed it when it was on sale, but after playing it I believe it's worth the $10.  There is a bit of a learning curve at first which makes the game feel almost impossible on the normal difficulty but if you stick to it, you'll learn your character and begin to defeat bosses and enemies with ease.  There are lots of items and unlockables and the maps are big enough that it doesn't feel too repetitive, both attributing to this games great replay-ability.  Personally I'm a fan of the artwork but it may not be for everybody.  This game also has a great base for future updates, looking forward to them!
